instructions.content:
CRUMBLE CORNBREAD AND MIX WITH REMAINING INGREDIENTS.  CHILL, THIS
RECIPE IS EVEN BETTER THE SECOND DAY.

Cut peppers in half and remove seed sections. Place pepper halves on a
paper towel and cook 6 minutes with microwave energy.  Cook onions
and beef an 8" round cake dish.about 4 minutes or untill all pink has
left the meat. r several times during cooking. cook rice according to
the directions given in cereal section. mix the tomatoe sauce with
water. combine onions, beef xture with cooked rice. half of the
tomatoe mixture, egg, salt and pepper stuff pepper halves and place
in a 2 quart glass utility dish. pour remain- ing tomatoe sauce over
the top and place wax paper over the dish. cook with crowave energy
10 minutes.

OPTIONAL COCONUT, RAISINS, CHO-CHIPS MAY BE ADDED TO THE BATTER.  MIX
THE ABOVE INGREDIENTS AND DROP BY TEASPOON ON COOKIE SHEET AND BAKE
AT 375 DEGREES.  FOR CRISPER COOKIES ADD 1/3 CUP SUGAR.

COMBINE SUGAR, FLOUR AND ONE-HALF TEASPOON OF THE SALT.  GRADUALLY
STIR IN PINEAPPLE JUICE AND EGGS. COOK OVER MODERATE HEAT, STIRRING,
UNTIL THICKEN- ED.  ADD LEMON JUICE.  COOL MIXTURE TO ROOM
TEMPERATURE.
BRING WATER, REMAINING TWO TEASPOONS SALT AND OIL TO BOIL.  ADD
ACINI DE PEPE, RINSE WITH WATER, DRAIN AGAIN AND COOL TO ROOM
TEMPERATURE.COMBINE EGG MIXTURE AND ACINI DE PEPE.  MIX LIGHTLY BUT
THOROUGHLY.  REFRIGERATE OVERNIGHT IN AIRTIGHT CONTAINER.  ADD
REMAINING INGREDIENTS.  MIX LIGHTLY BUT THOROUGHLY.  REFRIGERATE
UNTIL CHILLED IN AIRTIGHT CONTAINER.  SALAD MAY BE REFRIGERATED FOR
AS LONG AS A WEEK IN AIRTIGHT CONTAINER.  SALAD MAY ALSO BE FROZEN,
THOUGH FREEZING SOMEWHAT ALTERS THE TEXTURE.

* Note: Okra can be used instead of filet, both are optional.
** Note: Crab boil in the knot of a dish towel can be used if a tea
strainer is not available.

Roux Microwave: - Stir together 2 cups of flour and 1 cup of
vegetable oil in large microwave safe bowl.  Micro for appr. 15
minutes or until the color of chocolate, stirring about once a minute
whenever roux begins to bubble.

Roux Stove: - Stir together 2 cups of flour and 1 cup of criscoe in
large (iron, if have one) skillet.  Continuously stir on medium heat
for appr. 45 minutes until roux is chocolate color.  Continuous
stirring is required to keep roux from sticking to bottom of skillet.
Caution:  Do not over cook roux to black.

After roux is chocolate color add the frozen okra (optional) to the
roux first and stir.  Continue stirring and add the rest of the diced
vegetables (green onion, onion, bell pepper, celery). The roux
continues to cook after removing from microwave or heat so it is
important to stir in the vegetables quickly to cool it down so it
wont burn.


While roux is cooking boil water with redpepper, blackpepper, salt
and tea strainer of crabboil in a two gallon pot. Don't overboil
water with spices causing execessive water loss to evaporation.  If
water has come to a boil and roux is not ready, turn down heat and
simmer.  Bring water to boil again before adding roux. Add roux to
the boiling pot of water a little at a time till all is dissolved.
More water can be added to get desired consistancy.  Turn heat to
medium and cook until vegetables are tender - appr. 30 minutes.
Bring pot to boil again and add peeled uncooked shrimp and crab meat
and boil for appr. 5 minutes or until shrimp are cooked. Shrimp turn
orange when done.

Rice: prepare as directed on bag - Bring 2 cups of water and 1 t salt
to a boil.  After boiling add 1 cup rice and stir until mixture
starts to boil again.  Turn heat to low, cover pot and cook approx.
20 minutes or until rice is dry.

Serve in bowl over rice with crackers.

Chicken and sausage gumbo:  Boil chicken in 6 quarts of water, cool
broth in refrigerator and skim grease off top.  Debone chicken.  Fry
3 lbs sausage and drain off grease.  Prepare roux as before.  Use
chicken broth to dissolve roux in.  Add chicken and sausage in place
of shrimp.  An eight ounce can of tomato sauce can be added when
dissolving roux in chicken broth if desired.

HINTS: Have shrimp peeled and ready in advance.  Vegetables can also
be diced in advance.  Roux can be made in advance and refrigerated.
Unused portions can be frozen in plastic containers.  Don't put warm
pot of Gumbo in the refrigerator - will warm up the rest of fridge.
Use paper towl on chilled gumbo to separate and spoon off grease.
Stir well when reheating.

Melt margarine, peanut butter and marshmallows and blend well.
Remove from heat, stir in cocoa, and add cereal and chips.  Blend
well and press out on buttered 9" square pan.  Let cool and cut.
Mix all ingredients together.  Bake at 350 for 35 minutes. Serve hot.

Combine sugar, margarine and milk.  Bring to a rolling boil.  Stir
constantly for 5 minutes. (234 degrees) Remove from heat then stir
in chocolate pieces and all other ingredients.  Pour into 9x13
greased pan.

Beat together one 8 oz. pkg. softened cream cheese and 1/2 cup sugar
until creamy.  Blend in 2 cups thawed cool whip.  Pour into unbaked 9
inch graham cracker crust.  Top with 1 cup canned cherry pie filling.
Chill at least 3 hours before serving.

Beat first three items together. Pour into a graham cracker crust.
Slice banannas on top.  Pour can of pie mix on top.
Mix by hand and pour into crust.

Combine all ingredients in large pan.  Melt almond bark (in microwave
oven).  Pour over and mix thoroughly so everything is coated.  Spread
out on wax paper or counter top real thin to dry.  Separate and store
in air tight container.
** Toast pecans in microwave 6 minutes.  Stir and toast 6 or so more.
(withour salt or butter)

MIX SALAD DRESSING AND CREAM CHEESE.  BEAT WITH ELECTRIC MIXER.  AD
CHEDDAR CHEESE AND BLEND.  COVER AND FREEZE FOR 30 MIN.  SHAPE CHEESE
INTO BALLS. ROLL IN ALMONDS.  YOU CAN FREEZE THEM.
PREPARE HIDDEN VALLEY RANCH MILK RECIPE ORIGINAL RANCH SALAD DRESSING
DOUBLE STRENGTH.

MIX ALL INGREDIENTS (WILL BE THICK).  SPREAD AND PAT IN A GREASED AND
FLOURED 9 X 13 PAN.  BAKE AT 350 FOR 15 MINUTES, THEN TAKE OUT AND
SHAKE DOWN.  RETURN TO OVEN FOR 10 TO 15 MINUTES.  ALSO GOOD WITH
CHOCOLATE CHIPS

MELT BUTTER, MIX IN FLOUR AND PECANS AND PRESS INTO BOTTOM OF 9 X 13
PAN. BAKE AT 350 FOR 15 TO 20 MINUTES.
MIX 8-OZ PKG. CREAM CHEES AND 8 OZ. CARTON NON-DAIRY WHIPPED TOPPING.
ADD 3 CUPS POWDERED SUGAR.  SPOON OVER CRUST.  TOPWITH CHERRY PIE
FILLING.

BEAT EGGS AND ADD BROWN SUGAR.  SIFT THE FLOUR WITH THE BAKING POWDER
AND SALT.  ADD TO MIXTURE MELTED BUTTER AND VANILLA THEN MIX WELL.
STIR IN PECANS AND BAKE IN A GREASED 9 X 13 PAN FOR 45 MIN. AT 325
DEGREES.  COOL BEORE CUTTING INTO BARS.  SPRINKLE ON POWDERED SUGAR.

SPREAD OUT AND BAKE CRESCENT ROLLS AS A CRUST.  MIX CREAM CHEESE AND
MAYO AND SPREAD ON CRUST.  CHOP VEGIES ( CARROTTS, TOMATOES,
BROCOLLI, ETC. ) AND PLACE THEM ON THE PIZZA.  SERVE COLD.

MIX BEANS AND SEASONING AND SPREAD ON THE BOTTOM OF A DISH.  THEN
SPREAD A LAYER OF SOUR CREAM ON TOP OF THE ABOVE, FOLLOWED BY A LAYER
OF CHOPPED ONIONS, FOLLOWED BY A LAYER OF CHOPPED BLACK OLIVES,
FOLLOWED BY A LAYER OF FRESH TOMATOES CUT IN SMALL PIECES.  TOP ALL
OF THE ABOVE WITH GRATED MONTEREY JACK CHEESE WITH JALAPENO PEPPERS.

MIX PERSERVES, MUSTARD, AND HORSERADISH.  POUR OVER CREAM CHEESE.
SERVE WITH CRACKERS.

MELT CHEESE AND BUTTER IN DOUBLE BOILER.  BROWN GROUND MEAT AND DRAIN.
SAUTE ONION AND PEPPERS.  BY THE TIME YOU FINISH BROWING MEAT AND
SAUTEING ONIONS AND PEPPERS, THE CHEESE SHOULD BE MELTED ENOUGH TO ADD
ALL OTHER INGREDIENTS TO IT.  STIR IN WELL, SAVING TABASCO FOR LAST.
THIS SHOULD BE ADDED TO SUIT YOURSELF.

BLEND ONIONS AND PEPPERS.  WHIP CHEESE AND MAYNOISE.  THEN ADD ONION
AND PEPPERS.  LET IT SET 1 HR. THEN WHIP UNTIL SMOOTH.
MIX INGREDIENTS TOGETHER.  ROLL IN CHOPPED PECANS AND CHILI POWDER.

MIX ALL INGREDIENTS TOGETHER. ADD MORE ORANGE JUICE TO SUIT YOUR
TASTE. SERVE WITH FRESH FRUIT.

MIX OLEO, BISQUICK, AND MILK.  ROLL OUT IN 4 SEPARATE PARTS.  SPREAD
THE SAUSAGE OVER THE DOUGH THEN ROLL.  FREEZE AND CUT. BAKE AT 350
FOR 15 MIN.
MIX ALL INGREDIENTS TOGETHER AND BAKE AT 300 FOR 1 1/4 HOURS.

MIX AND ROLL IN BALLS. (75)  BAKE AT 350 FOR 10 -12 MINUTES OR UNTIL
BROWN. THESE CAN BE FROQEN BEFORE BAKING.

SOFTEN CREAM CHEESE AND MIX WELL WITH OTHER INGREDIENTS.  FORM INTO
BALL AND ROLL IN CHOPPED NUTS.

MIX THROUGHLY ALL INGREDIENTS.  REFRIGERATE SEVERAL HOURS BEFORE
SERVING. ADD SALT AND PEPPER TO TASTE.  SERVE WITH FRESH VEGETABLES.

HEAT OVEN TO HOT (450).  MELT BUTTER IN THE OVEN IN AN OVLONG PAN (9
X 13) REMOVE THE PAN FROM THE OVEN WHEN THE BUTTER IS MELTED.  SIFT
THE DRY INGREDIENTS INTO A BOWL.  ADD THE MILK AND STIR SLOWLY WITH A
FORK UNTIL THE DOUGH JUST CLINGS TOGETHER, ABOUT 30 STROKES.  TURN
OUT DOUGH ONTO A WELL FLOURED BOARD AND KNEAD IT LIGHTLY ABOUT 10
TIMES.  ROLL OUT THE DOUGH INTO A RECTANGULAR 8 X 12 1/2 INCH THICK.
CUT INTO STRIPS 1/2 X 4.  DIP EACH STRIP INTO THE MELTED BUTTER, SO
THAT EVERY STRIP IS COATED ON BOTH SIDES.  PLACE THE STRIPS CLOSE
TOGETHER IN TWO ROWS IN A PAN.  BAKE 15 TO 20 MINUTES, OR UNTIL
GOLDEN BROWN.  IT IS BOOD WITH STEW, CHILI, ETC.

IN A SMALL BOWL, COMBINE CHEDDAR CHEESE, CREAM CHEESE AND MARGARINE
UNTIL WELL BLENDED.  SPREAD ONE FOURTH OF MIXTURE ON ONE HAM SLICE;
REPEAT WITH REMAINING CHEESE MIXTURE AND HAM SLICES.  ROLL UP FROM
SHORT SIDES; CHILL FOR SEVERAL HOURS, OR WRAP AND FREEZE, IF DESIRED.
TO SERVE, SLICE ROLLS INTO 1/2 INCH THICK SLICES.  ARANGE SLICES ON
TOPOF RITZ CRACKERS.  IF FROZEN, LET STAND AT ROOM TEMPERATURE 20
MINUTES BEFORE SERVING.

SIFT ALL DRY INGREDIENTS ONCE INCLUDING SPICES.  COMBINE SUGAR, OIL
AND EGGS, THEN ADD PUMPKIN, DRY INGREDIENTS, WATER AND NUTS LAST.
GREASE AND FLOUR 3 LOAF PANS OR 15 SMALL LOAF PANS.  BAKE AT 350 FOR
1 HOUR IN LARGE PANS OR 30 MINUTES IN SMALL PANS.

IF A GREATER AMOUNT OF SUGAR IS USED THE ROLLS WILL BE SWEETER.  IF A
GREATER AMOUNT OF SHORTENING IS USED, THE ROLLS WILL BE RICHER AND
MORE TENDER.  NOT LESS THAN 2 OR MORE THAN 8 TABLESPOONS OF SUGAR OR
SHORTENING SHOULD BE USED.  FOLLOW GENERAL DIRECTIONS FOR MAKING
BREAD KNEADING IN A LITTLE LESS FLOUR AND PERMITTING THE DOUGH TO
BECOME LIGHTER DURING EACH RISING PROCESS.  BOTH AFTER IT IS SHAPED
AND BEFORE THE ROLLS ARE PLACED IN IN THE OVEN.  WHEN DOUGH IS LIGHT,
CUT TO TEAR IT INTO PIECES.  FOLD SIDES UNDER UNTIL TOP OF ROLL IS
PERFECTLY SMOOTH.  BRUSH TOP WITH FAT.  PLACE IN GREASED BREAD PAN ON
BAKING SHEET OR IN INDIVIDUAAL MOLDS.  WHEN LIGHT, BAKE IN HOT OVEN,
AT 425 UNTIL GOLDEN BROWN.

COMBINE ALL INGREDIENTS; MIX THOROUGHLY.  FRY IN DEEP FAT IN HEAVY
SAUCEPAN OR DEEP FAT FRYER AT 370.  DROP BATTER BY THE TABLESPOONFUL
OR TEASPOONFUL INTO HOT FAT.  FRY A FEW AT A TIME UNTIL GOLDEN BROWN
ON ALL SIDES.  DRAIN ON PAPER TOWELS.  SERVE HOT. MAKES ABOUT 2 DOZEN
LARGE HUSH PUPPIES OR 5 DOZEN SMALL HUSH PUPPIES.

MIX CORN MUFFIN MIX, EGG, MILK, CORN, PEPPER SAUCE, SALT, DILL SEED,
CHEESE AND SOUR CREAM.  SAUTE ONIONS IN THE 1/4 CUP BUTTER.  POUR
MIXTURE IN A GREASED DISH, TOP WITH THE ONIONS AND BUTTER.  BAKE AT
350 FOR 30 MINUTES OR UNTIL GOLDEN BROWN.

COMBINE YEAST, WATER, SUGAR AND SALT.  PLACE INA WARM PLACE UNTIL
BUBBLY. ADD FLOUR, MIX WELL AND LET RISE FOR ONE HOUR.  BRUSH WITH
COOKING OIL. WORK DOWN AND MAKE INTO ROLLS, COAT WITH BUTTER AND
PLACE IN A GREASED PAN. LET RISE ANOTHER HOUR.  BAKE AT 375 FOR 30
MINUTES OR UNTIL BROWN.

CREAM BUTTER, SUGAR AND BROWN SUGAR THEN ADD EGGS, ONE AT A TIME AND
BEAT WELL.  ADD BANNANAS.  MIX THEN ADD FLOUR SIFTED WITH SODA AND
BAKE IN LOAF PAN AT 350 FOR ABOUT 45 MINUTES.  ADD NUTS AS DESIRED TO
BATTER.

PINCH UP CRISCO - MIX WITH YOUR HANDS.  SCOOP OUT ONTO FLOUR SUFACE.
SPRINKLE WITH FLOUR.  KNEAD 3 OR 4 TIMES.  PRESS OUT ABOUT 1/2 INCH
THICK.  CUT.  BAKE AT 450 FOR ABOUT 20 MINUTES.

PUT CORNBREAD MIX IN BOWL.  ADD MILK AND EGGS.  THEN CORN, PEPPERS,
CHEESE AND ONION.  HEAT SALAD OIL ADD TO MIXTURE.  STIR WELL.  POUR
INTO 3-8 INCH OILED PANS OR LARGE SKILLET AND BAKE AT 375 FOR 45
MINUTES OR UNTIL BROWN.

MIX EGGS, CORNMEAL, SALT, SODA, BAKING POWDER, MILK AND OIL.  MIX
VERY WELL THEN ADD THE CORN CHILIES AND CHEESE.  THEN ADD THE BROWNED
GROUNDMEAT AND ONIONS.  BAKE in 13"X9" PAN AT 425 FOR ABOUT 25
MINUTES.

MEASURE 1/2 CUP OF WARM WATER INTO MIXING BOWL.  STIR IN YEAST UNTIL
DIS- SOLVED.  THEN STIR IN THE REMAINER OF THE WATER.  ADD THE SUGAR,
SALT, EGGS SHORTENING AND FLOUR.  MIX WITH SPOON UNTIL SMOOTH.  ADD
ENOUGH REMAINING FLOUR TO HANDLE EASILY;  MIX WITH HAND.  TURN ONTO
LIGHTLY FLOUR BOARD; KNEAD UNTIL SMOOTH AND ELASTIC (ABOUT 5 MIN.).
ROUND UP IN GREASED BOWL, GREASED SIDE UP.  COVER WITH DAMP CLOTH.
LET RISE IN WARM PLACE UNTIL DOUBLE IN SIZE (ABOUT 1 1/2 HOURS).
PUNCH DOWN; LET RISE AGAIN UNTIL ALMOST DOUBLE AGAIN (ABOUT 30
MINUTES).  DIVIDE DOUGH FOR DESIRED ROLLS. SHAPE AND LET RISE.  ROLL
DOUGH AND 1/8 INCH THICK INTO AN OBLONG 6 INCH WIDE.  SPREAD WITH
SOFT BUTTER AND ROLL UP LIKE A JELLY ROLL.  CUT INTO 2 INCH PIECES.
MAKE A DEEP IMPRESSION WITH NARROW HANDLE IN MIDDLE OF EACH ROLL ( TO
RESEMBLE BUTTERFLY).

COMBINE ALL INGREDIENTS; BLEND WELL.  SPLIT A LOAF OF FRENCH BREAD
INTO 3 PIECES.  SPREAD MIXTURE ON ONE SIDE OF EACH PIECE OF BREAD.
BAKE AT 350 FOR 25 TO 30 MINUTES.  YOU CAN MAKE AND FREEZE EXTRA
BAKED OR UNBAKED.

CUT EACH BISCUIT INTO 4 PIECES.  PUT A CHUNK OF CREAM CHEESE IN THE
CENTER OF EACH PIECE THEN DIP INTO THE MELTED BUTTER.  NEXT MIX THE
SUGAR, ORANGE PEEL AND NUTS IN A BOWL.  THEN ROLL EACH BUTTER DIPPED
BISCUIT IN THE SUGAR MIXTURE.  PLACE THE PIECES IN A BUNT PAN AND
BAKE AT 350 FOR 30 MINUTES.
MIX ALL INGREDIENTS TOGETHER.  BAKE IN OVEN AT 350 FOR 45 MINUTES.

MIX ALL INGREDIENTS TOGETHER.  LINE PAN WITH WAXED PAPER.  PACK
FIRMLY AND TIGHTLY.  BAKE IN PRE-HEATED OVEN AT 300 FOR 1 HOUR.
REMOVE WAX PAPER WHILE THE CAKE IS STILL HOT.

MIX ALL INGREDIENTS TOGETHER AND BAKE AT 350.
COOL CAKE BEFORE ICING.
ICING
1 8OZ CREAM CHEESE
1 STICK OLEO
1 BOX POWERED SUGAR
1 TBS VANILLA

COMBINE ALL INGREDIENTS AND BAKE AT 350.  COOL CAKE BEFORE ICING.

ICING
1 1/2 PKG POWDERED SUGAR
1/4 CUP BUTTER
1 CUP NUTS
3 BANNANAS

PUT COCOA, OLEO, CRISCO AND WATER IN A BOILER AND BOIL FOR 3 MINUTES.
REMOVE FROM HEAT THEN IN A MIXING BOWL PUT THE FLOUR AND SUGAR.  POUR
THE HOT MIXTURE OVER THE FLOUR AND SUGAR AND BEAT WELL.  BAKE AT 350.

MIX ALL INGREDIENTS TOGETHER.  BAKE IN TUBE PAN.  USE 3 LAYER WAXED
PAPER. BAKE AT 350 FOR 1 1/2 HOURS.

IN 13 X 9 PAN, DUMP PINEAPPLE (DO NOT DRAIN) SPREADING EVENLY. DUMP
PIE FILLING AND SPREAD INTO EVEN LAYER.  DUMP DRY CAKE MIX ON THE
CHERRY LAYER - DON'T MIX. SPRINKLE CHOPPED NUTS OVER CAKE MIX.  POUR
MELTED OLEO OVER THE TOP. BAKE AT 350 FOR 50 MINUTES TO 1 HOUR.

COMBINE ALL INGREDIENTS.  BAKE AT 350.

FUDGE ICING
1 CUP SUGAR
1/4 CUP OLEO
1/4 CUP MILK
1/4 CUP COCOA
1 tsp. VANILLA
CHOPPED NUTS
COOK UNTIL IT COMES TO A ROLLING BOIL.  BOIL ABOUT 2 MINUTES OR UNTIL
IT FORMS A SOFT BALL.

MIX EGGS, SUGAR, OLEO AND CRISCO.  BEAT A LONG TIME.  THEN ADD ALL DRY
INGREDIENTS AND BAKE AT 325 FOR 1 1/2 HOURS.  DO NOT OPEN OVEN.

MIX MILK, ORANGE JUICE AND MARSHMELLOWS FIRST IN A BOWL.  THEN ROLL
GRAHAM CRACKERS UNTIL CRUSHED.  PUT CRACKERS IN A LARGE BOWL WITH THE
CINNAMON, NUTMEG, CLOVES, RAISINS, DATES AND NUTS.  NEXT ADD THE
CANDIED FRUIT.  ADD MILK MIXTURE AND DRY MIXTURE TOGETHER.  MIX WITH
A SPOON AND PRESS INTO PAN AND COVER TIGHT.

PUT APPLES AND SUGAR IN A LARGE BOWL AND LET STAND FOR 1 HOUR.  THEN
MIX FLOUR, SODA, AND SALT WITH THE APPLES AND SUGAR.   THEN MIX
REMAINING IN- GREDIENTS IN AND POUR INTO GREASED TUBE PAN AND BAKE AT
350 FOR 1 HOUR AND 15 MINUTES.

COMBINE THE OIL AND SUGAR.  ADD EGGS, ONE AT A TIME, AND BEAT WELL
AFTER EACH ADDITION.  ADD THE PRUNES AND APRICOTS.  SIFT FLOUR,
NUTMEG, CINNAMON, SODA AND SALT TOGETHER.  FOLD NOT BEAT INTO THE
FIRST MIXTURE.  ADD CHOPPED PECANS.  BAKE IN A GREASED AND FLOURED
TUBE PAN FOR ONE HOUR AT 350.  THIS CAKE KEEPS WELL.

MIX DRY INGREDIENTS.  ADD OIL AND EGGS.  STIR IN PINEAPPLE AND MIX
WELL. ADD NUTS AND BAKE IN 9 X 12 PAN AT 350 FOR 45 MINUTES.

ICING
1 STICK BUTTER
1 BOX POWDERED SUGAR
1 8 OZ PKG CREAM CHEESE
2 TSP VANILLA
CREAM ALL INGREDIENTS AND POUR OVER CAKE WHILE IT IS STILL WARM.

MIX ALL INGREDIENTS TOGETHER.  GREASE AND FLOUR PANS  AND BAKE AT 350
UNTIL DONE.  WHEN CAKE IS DONE PLACE SMALL MARSHMELLOWS ON TOP AND
RETURN TO OVEN LONG ENOUGH FOR MARSHMELLOWS TO PUFF UP.  MASH
MARSHMELLOWS TOGETHER WITH A SPOON.  LET CAKE COOL IN PAN.

ICING
1/3 CUP COCOA
1 STICK OLEO - MELTED
1 BOX POWDERED SUGAR
1/3 CUP MILK
1 TSP. VANILLA
MELT OLEO AND COCOA TOGETHER, THEN ADD ALL OTHER INGREDIENTS.

CUT BISCUITS INTO QUARTERS.  MIX 1 CUP SUGAR WITH 3 TSP CINNAMON IN A
BOWL. MELT THE MARGARINE AND ADD 1 CUP SUGAR.  GREASE AND FLOUR TUBE
PAN.  LINE BOTTOM WITH CHERRY HALVES AND NUT PIECES.  COAT EACH
BISCUIT PIECE IN CIN- NAMON AND SUGAR MIXTURE.  PUT 1/2 OF COATED
BISCUIT PIECES IN TUBE PAN. ADD MORE NUTS AND CHERRIES.  MIX LEFT
OVER CINNAMON MIXTURE IN BUTTER AND SUGAR.  POUR IN REMAINING COATED
PIECES.  PREHEAT OVEN TO 350 AND BAKE FOR 45 MINUTES.  REMOVE FROM
PAN AFTER 10 MINUTES.  SERVE BY PINCHING  - NOT BY CUTTING.

SIFT TOGETHER FLOUR, SALT, SOD, AND SPICES.  ADD BUTTERMILK GRADUALLY
ADD FIGS, NUTS AND VANILLA.  POUR IN LOAF PAN AND BAKE AT 325 FOR 45
MINUTES.

CREAM BUTTER AND SUGAR.  ADD EGGS, SALT, BAKING POWDER, SODA AND
VANILLA. ADD FLOUR AND SOUR CREAM.  IN TUBE PAN, PUT LAYER OF BATTER,
THEN SWIRL LAYER OF CRANBERRIES ON TOP.  ADD REMAINING BATTER AND TOP
WITH REMAINING CRANBERRIES.  SPRINKLE TOP WITH NUTS.  BAKE AT 350 FOR
55 MINUTES.

TOPPING FOR CAKE
3/4 CUP POWDERED SUGAR
1/2 TSP SALT
1 TSP VANILLA
1 TBS WARM WATER.
DRIBBLE OVER CAKE.

POUR ALL INGREDIENTS INTO AN ICECREAM FREEZER.  STIR.  TURN UNTIL
FIRM.

POUR ALL INGREDIENTS INTO ICE CREAM FREEZER.  STIR.  TURN UNTIL FIRM.
ADD STRAWBERRIES (FRESH OR FROZEN) IF DESIRED.
MIX TOGETHER IN BAKING DISH.  BAKE AT 350 UNTIL BROWN. (30-35 MINUTES)

BEAT EGGS SLIGHTLY.  ADD SUGAR TO EGGS AND BEAT.  THEN ADD ALL OTHER
INGREDIENTS.  POUR CUSTARD IN AN UNBAKED PIE SHELL AND SPRINKLE WITH
NUTMEG ON TOP.  HEAT OVEN TO 400.  PUT PIE IN OVEN AND LOWER HEAT TO
300.

MELT OLEO.  ADD ONIONS, CELERY AND BELL PEPPER.  COOK UNTIL ALMOST
TENDER. THEN ADD TOMATOES AND ROTEL TOMATOES.  ADD SALT, PEPPER, AND
WOSTERSHIRE SAUCE TO TASTE.  NEXT ADD UNCOOKED SHRIMP.  COOK UNTIL
TENDER.  JUST BEFORE DONE ADD A LITTLE FLOUR TO THICKEN.

PUT OIL AND FLOUR IN PAN AND COOK IN THE OVEN UNTIL BROWN - APROX. 2
HRS. SET THE OVEN AT 350.  STIR EVERY 15 TO 20 MINUTES.  AFTER IT IS
DONE ADD CELERY, ONION, BELL PEPPERS, THAT HAVE BEEN CHOPPED AND
SAUTED.

IN ONE BOWL BEAT EGGS, MILK, AND SEASONING.  IN ANOTHER BOWL COMBINE
CORN MEAL AND FLOUR.  DIP SHRIMP IN EGG BATTER THEN ROLL IN CORNMEAL
AND FLOUR THEN FRY.

MIX ALL INGREDIENTS TOGETHER.  POUR INTO UNBAKED PIE SHELL.  COOK AT
350 UNTIL DONE.

COMBINE ALL INGREDIENTS.  PUT IN GREASED PAN AND BAKE AT 400 FOR 30
MIN.

MIX TOGETHER ALL INGREDIENTS.  POUR INTO A GRAHAM CRACKER CRUST.
REFRIDGERATE.    YOUR CAN TOP WITH FRESH STRAWBERRIES.

MELT OLEO IN PAN.  MIX DOUGH UP AND PLACE IT IN THE MELTED OLEO.
POUR THE FRUIT OF YOUR CHOICE ON TOP.  BAKE AT 350 UNTIL GOLDEN BROWN.

MIX TOGETHER IN MIXER AND PUT IN GREASED 9 INCH PIE PLATE.  BAKE AT
350 FOR ABOUT 45 MINUTES.

COOK SUGAR MILK AND CORNSTARCH UNTIL THICK.  THEN ADD BUTTER AND
VANILLA. POUR INTO BAKED PIE SHELL.  SPRINKLE THE TOP WITH CINNAMON
OR NUTMEG.  BAKE AT 375 FOR 15 TO 20 MINUTES.

COMBINE 57 SAUCE AND HONEY.  BRUSH CHICKEN WITH MELTED BUTTER, THEN 57
SAUCE-HONEY MIXTURE.  GRILL OR BROIL UNTIL CHICKEN IS COOKED, TURNING
AND BRUSHING FREQUENTLY WITH 57 SAUCE-HONEY MIXTURE.

Boil onions, celery & pepper in chicken broth seasoned with salt,
pepper & red pepper till tender.  Crumble cornbread & bread. Add
mashed boiled eggs. Add broth with vegetables, make it moist but not
soupy.  Bake at 350 about 40-45 min.
MIX SOUR CREAM, COOL WHIP AND DRY JELLO.  LAST PUT IN DRAINED FRUIT.

DRAIN PINEAPPLES AND ORANGES.  MIX INGREDIENTS AND REFRIGERATE FOR 6
HOURS.
COMBINE ALL INGREDIENTS AND REFRIGERATE UNTIL READY TO SERVE.

Mix can of undrained pineapple with pudding mix, stir well. Fold in
cool whip then add pecans and marshmallows. Chill at least 1 hr
before serving.
MIX WELL - LET SET IN REFRIGERATOR OVERNIGHT.

LET WATER AND SUGAR COOK UNTIL FORMS HARD BALL IN WATER OR THREAD.
PUT MARSHMELLOW CREAM IN LARGE MIXING BOWL AND POUR SYRUP OVER THIS
AND BEAT UNTIL HARD.  THEN SPOON OUT ON WAX PAPER.

MIX IN A LARGE BOWL AND SHAPE INTO BALLS.

COATING
MELT A SIX OZ PKG. OV CHOCOLATE CHIPS WITH 1/4 A BAR OF PARAFFIN OVER
WARM WATER.  DIP BALLS IN CHOCOLATE AND PLACE ON WAX PAPER.

BRING SUGAR, HONEY, AND KARO TO A BOIL.  ADD PEANUT BUTTER AND STIR
UNTIL MELTED.  LAST ADD THE COCO PUFFS.  DROP ONTO WAX PAPER THE SIZE
YOU WANT THEM TO BE.

CRUSH GRAHAM CRACKERS.  ADD OTHER INGREDIENTS (YOU MAY INCREASE ANY
OR ALL INGREDIENTS).  ADD CHERRY JUICE AND MIX WITH HAND UNTIL YOU
CAN FORM INTO ROLLS.  SAVE SOME CRUMBS TO ROLL IN.  WRAP IN FOIL.
WILL KEEP FOR 2 OR MORE MONTHS.
PERK.

MELT SUGAR AND KARO.  PUT PEANUT BUTTER IN LAST.  POUR OVER CORN
FLAKES. PRESS INTO PAN AND CUT WHILE WARM OR SCOOP OUT.

BRING TO BOIL AND BOIL TO SOFT BALL STANGE.  REMOVE FROM HEAT AND
DROP IN 2 CUPS PECANS.  STIR UNTIL ALL PECANS ARE WILL COATED.
SPREAD OUT ON WAXED PAPER UNTIL COOL.  BREAD INTO PIECES.

MELT CARAMEL WITH THE MILK.  ADD THE CORNFLAKES, RICE KRISPIES AND
PECANS. SHAPE INTO BALLS.  ROLL IN POWDERED SUGAR.

CREAM OLEO, SUGAR AND MILK.  ADD VANILLA AND PECANS.  ROLL INTO SMALL
BALLS AND PLACE ON WAX PAPER.  LEAVE UNTIL HARD.  MELT ONE BLOCK OF
WAX AND ONE BLOCK OF SEMI SWEET CHOCOLATE.  DIP BALLS AND LET COOL.

COMBINE SUGAR, MILK, BUTTER AND COCOA IN A POT.  COOK ON MEDIUM HEAT
UNTIL IT COMES TO A GOOD BOIL.  REMOVE FROM HEAT.  ADD OTHER
INGREDIENTS.  STIR AND DROP ON WAX PAPER.

COMBINE ALL INGREDIENTS.  ROLL AND CUT OUT COOKIES.  BAKE AT 350 FOR
10 MINUTES.

FROSTING
POWDERED SUGAR
WATER
MILK
VANILLA
FOOD COLORING

PUT SALT, CINNAMON, SUGAR AND CLOVES IN BASKET.  PUT LIQUID IN THE
BOTTOM OF ELECTRIC COFFEE POT AND CYCLE.

MIX ALL INGREDIENTS TOGETHER.  THEN ADD ENOUGH FLOUR TO MAKE DOUGH
STIFF ENOUGH TO ROLL OUT.  BAKE AT 375 FOR ABOUT 10 MINUTES.

REFRIGERATE ABOUT 4 HOURS.  FORM IN BALLS AND ROLL IN POWERED SUGAR
AND PECAN MEAL.

MIX LETTUCE, BELL PEPPER, GREEN ONIONS, AND CELERY (USING MORE OR
LESS OF EACH AS DESIRED).  PLACE IN THE BOTTOM OF A CASSEROLE DISH.
THEN PLACE A LAYER OF ENGLISH PEAS ON NEXT.  COVER THE PEAS WITH
MAYO.  GRATE CHEESE ON THE TOP OF THE MAYO.  SPRINKLE THE BACON BITS
ON LAST.

DISSOLVE JELLO IN WATER.  ADD PINEAPPLE, BANANNAS, NUTS AND THAWED
STRAW- BERRIES.  POUR HALF IN DISH AND CHILL QUICKLY (FREEZER).
SPREAD SOUR CREAM ON TOP OF LAYER WHEN FIRM.  TOP WITH REMAINING
JELLO AND REFRIGERATE.

MELT BUTTER IN SAUCE PAN.  ADD FLOUR AND HEAT FOR 3-5 MINUTES.  ADD
PEPPER AND MILK AND COOK UNTIL THICK.

THINGS YOU CAN DO WITH CREME SAUCE
1.  CREME SAUCE AND DRIED BEEF ON TOAST OR RICE
2.  CHICKEN POT PIE
3.  NEW POTATOES IN CREME SAUCE
MIX TOGETHER.  CHILL ABOUT 1 HOUR BEFORE SERVING.

BEAT EGG WHITES, SUGAR AND SALT UNTIL STIFF.  ADD CHOCOLATE CHIPS AND
NUTS. ADD VANILLA.  DROP BY TEASPOON ON A GREASED COOKIE SHEET.  TURN
OFF OVEN AND LEAVE AT LEAST 1 1/2 HOURS OR OVERNIGHT.  PREHEAT OVEN
TO 35O.
MIX ABOVE IN A LARGE BOWL.  SAVE FRITOS UNTIL READY TO SERVE.

DRAIN ORANGES, RESERVING 2 TABLESPOONS LIQUID.  COMBINE ORANGES AND
LIQUID WITH REMAINING INGREDIENTS; MIX LIGHTLY. COVER; CHILL UP TO 2
HOURS BEFORE SERVING.

COMBINE INGREDIENTS; MIX LIGHTLY. CHILL.

VARIATIONS:  SUBSTITUTE 1 CUP PEACH SLICES FOR STRAWBERRIES.
SUBSTITUTE 11 OZ. CAN MANDARIN ORANGE SEGMENTS, DRAINED
FOR
STRAWBERRIES.
MIX TOGETHER.  ADD COCONUT IF DESIRED.  BAKE AT 325 UNTIL BROWN.

DRAIN GREEN BEANS, ADD SOUP AND TOP WITH ONION RINGS.  BAKE 40
MINUTES.

COMBINE ALL INGREDIENTS IN A BOWL AND BLEND AT LOW SPEED WITH MIXER
FOR ONE MINUTE.  SERVE IMMEDIATELY WITH A SPRINKLE OF NUTMEG.

PLACE ON UNGREASED COOKIE SHEET WITH ICE CREAM SCOOP.  BAKE AT 350
UNTIL LIGHT BROWN.  DOUGH IS THICK.

PREHEAT OVEN TO 350.  GREASE AND FLOUR 13 X 9 PAN.  IN LARGE SAUCEPAN
OVER LOW HEAT MELT 1/2 CUP BUTTER AND 1 OZ. CHOCOLATE.  ADD REMAINING
BAR IN- GREDIENTS.  MIX WELL.  SPREAD IN PAN.

FILLING
8 OZ. CREAM CHEESE (UNSOFTENED)
1/2 CUP SUGAR
2 T FLOUR
1/4 CUP BUTTER SOFTENED
1 EGG
1/2 TSP. VANILLA
1/4 CUP WALNUTS
6 OZ. PKG. SEMI-SWEET CHOCOLATE PIECES

IN A SMALL BOWL, COMBINE 6 OZ. CREAM CHEESE WITH NEXT 5 FILLING
INGREDIENTS BLEND UNTIL SMOOTH AND FLUFFY.  STIR IN NUTS.  SPREAD
OVER CHOCOLATE MIX- TURE.  SPRINKLE WITH CHOCOLATE PIECES.  BAKE
25-30 MINUTES.  SPRINKLE WITH MARSHMALLOWS AND BAKE 2 MINUTES LONGER.

FROSTING
2 CUPS MINIATURE MARSHMALLOWS
1/4 CUP FLOUR
1 SQ. UNSWEETENED CHOCOLATE
1 TSP. VANILLA
REMAINING 2 OZ. CREAM CHEESE
1/4 CUP MILK
3 CUPS POWDERED SUGAR

IN LARGE SAUCEPAN OVER LOW HEAT, MELT 1/4 CUP BUTTER, 1 OZ. CHOCOLATE,
REMAINING 2 OZ. CREAM CHEESE AND MILK.  STIR IN POWDERED SUGAR AND
VANILLA UNTIL SMOOTH.  IMMEDIATELY POUR OVER MARSHMALLOWS AND SWIRL
TOGETHER.  COOL

MAKES APPROX. 3 DOZEN BARS.

MIX THROUGHLY BY MIXER ON LOW SPEED.  PUT ON BUTTERED COOKIE SHEET.
PRESS OUT EVENLY ON SHEET.  TOP WITH EGG WHITE SLIGHTLY BEATEN (ONLY
TILL A LITTLE FOAMY).  TAKE EGG WHITE IN BOWL AND BEAT WITH FORK.
POUR ON TOP OF COOKIES AND SPREAD EVENLY WITH HANDS.  SPREAD NUTS
EVENLY ON EGG WHITES. BAKE UNTIL BROWN FOR ABOUT 30 MINUTES.  CUT
WHILE WARM INTO SQUARES.

MIX HONEY, SUGAR, OIL AND EGG TOGETHER.  THEN MIX OTHER INGREDIENTS.
COOK IN OBLONG PAN. (FLOUR AND GREASE)  COOK AT 350 FOR 20 MINUTES.

ICING
1 C POWDERED SUGAR
1 t VANILLA
2 T SALAD DRESSING
1 - 2 T WATER

USE AT LEAST 1 CUP MORE OF FLOUR TO TOSS WITH FRUIT.  THEN MIX WITH
EGG MIXTURE - THOROUGHLY.  DROP ON GREASED COOKIE SHEETS IN SMALL
SPOONFULLS. BAKE IN SLOW OVEN ABOUT 15 MINUTES.

CREAM BUTTER AND ADD POWDERED SUGAR, FLOUR AND NUTS.  MIX WELL AND ADD
VANILLA.  DROP ON COOKIE SHEET FROM A TSP.  BAKE AT 350 FOR ABOUT 20
MIN. OR UNTIL LIGHTLY BROWN.  WHILE STILL HOT ROLL IN POWDERED SUGAR
AND COOL.
MAKES ABOUT 1 GALLON.

SERVE ON LETTUCE IF DESIRED. GARNED WITH TOMATOES OR HARD COOKED EGG
WEDGES SLICED OLIVES, GRATED CARROTTS, ETC.

IF DESIRED ADD SOME MAYONNAISE.  IN A LARGE BOWL, TOSS VEGETABLES.
COVER AND CHILL.  BEFORE SERVING COMBINE SUGAR, SALT, VINEGAR AND
OIL.  POUR OVER CABBAGE.  TOSS WELL.

BOIL AND DEBONE CHICKEN.  DIP TORTILLIA'S IN BROTH - LINE 9 X 12
BUTTERED PAN.  COMBINE ALL OTHER INGREDIENTS AND COOK FOR A FEW
MINUTES.  SHREAD CHICKEN AND LAY IN PAN ON TOP OF TORTILLIAS.  POUR
BATTER ON TOP. MICROWAVE FOR 10 MINUTES OR BAKE.  TOP WITH GRATED
CHEESE AND COOK UNTIL CHEESE MELTS.

MELT MARGARINE IN 13 X 9 PAN.  PUT UNCOOKED RICE IN PAN.  LAY CHICKEN
ON TOP OF RICE.  SPRINKLE ONION SOUP MIX ON TOP OF CHICKEN.  POUR
WATER OVER MIXTURE.  SALT AND PEPPER TO TASTE.  COVER WITH FOIL.
BAKE AT 350 FOR 2 HOURS.

BEAT FIRST 3 INGREDIENTS, THEN ADD DRY CAKE MIX.  BAKE IN 3 PANS AT
375.

ICING
1 CARTON (LARGE) COOL WHIP
1 CAN (LARGE) CRUSHED PINEAPPLES AND JUICE
1 PKG. (SMALL) INSTANT VANILLA PUDDING
MIX TOGETHER.  TOP BETWEEN LAYERS AND SIDES OF CAKE.

BOIL SPAGATTI IN THE CHICKEN BROTH.  DRAIN.  SAUTE ONION IN THE
BUTTER. ADD CHEESE WIZ, SOUPS, OLIVES AND PIMIENTOS.  SIMMER 5
MINUTES.  COMBINE ALL INGREDIENTS.

COMBINE SUGAR, FLOUR AND EGG YOLKS IN LARGE SAUCE PAN.  ADD MILK
STIRRING WELL.  ADD BUTTER;  COOK OVER MEDIUM HEAT STIRRING
CONSTANTLY UNTIL THICKENED.  STIR IN VANILLA, COOL, POUR INTO CUSTARD
CUPS.

CRUST
MIX OLEO, 3 T SUGAR AND PRETZELS.  PRESS INTO 9 X 12 INCH PAN.  BAKE
AT 350 FOR 10 MINUTES THEN LET COOL.

FILLING
DISSOLVE JELLO IN 2 CUPS HOT WATER.  ADD STRAWBERRIES.  COOL UNTIL
SET. CREAM CREAM CHEESE AND 1 CUP SUGAR.  ADD 2 CUPS COOL WHIP AND
MIX WELL. SPREAD CREAM CHEESE MIXTURE OVER CRUST.  THEN SPREAD JELLO
OVER THIS. SPREAD COOL WHIP OVER TOP AND CHILL.

MIX ALL INGREDIENTS TOGETHER IN THE ORDER LISTED.  POUR INTO PIE
SHELL ON OVEN SHELF TO PREVENT SPILLING.  PECANS WILL RISE TO TOP.
BAKE IN PRE- HEATED OVEN FOR 10 MINUTES AT 400 AND 35-40 MINUTES AT
350.  COOL TO ROOM TEMPERATURE AND SERVE.

MIX ALL INGREDIENTS.  POUR INTO UNBAKED PIE SHELL.  BAKE AT 350 UNTIL
KNIFE INSERTED IN CENTER COMES CLEAN - ABOUT 45 MINUTES.

MELT BUTTER IN LARGE SAUCEPAN OVER LOW HEAT.  ADD MARSHMALLOWS AND
COOK STIRRING CONSTANTLY UNTIL MARSHMALLOWS ARE MELTED AND MISTURE IS
VERY SYRUPY.  REMOVE FROM HEAT.  ADD RICE KRISPIES AND STIR UNTIL
WELL COATED. UNSING BUTTERED SPATULA OR WAXED PAPER PRESS MIXTURE
EVENLY AND FIRMLY IN BUTTER 13 X 9 X 2 INCH PAN.  CUT INTO SQUARES
WHEN COOL.
COMBINE ALL INGREDIENTS AND BAKE UNTIL DONE.

MELT MARGARINE. ADD SUGAR, GRAHAM CRACKERS, VANILLA, AND NUTS.  ROLL
INTO 1 INCH BALLS.  MELT CHOCOLATE CHIPS AND PARAFFIN.  DIP BALLLS IN
CHOC. REFRIDGERATE UNTIL HARD.

MELT CHOCOLATE CHIPS IN DOUBLE BOILER - REMOVE FROM HEAT - ADD ALL
OTHER INGREDIENTS.  STIR UNTIL SMOOTH.  POUR INTO 9 X 13 PAN.

BROWN MEAT WITH ONIONS AND TACO SEASONING.  HEAT TORTILLIAS IN WARM
GREASE UNTIL SOFT.  PLACE HAMBURGER IN SOFT SHELLS AND ROLL UP.
PLACE IN CAKE PAN.  THEN COVER WITH 2 CANS OF GOOD CHILLI AND A
LITTLE WATER.  SPRINKLE WITH CHEESE AND ONIONS.  BAKE AT 350 UNTIL
CHEESE MELTS AND OTHER IS HEATED THOURGHLY.

1.  PUT THE CHOCOLATE CHIPS AND PEANUT BUTTER INTO A LARGE GLASS OR
MICRO- WAVE BOWL.  SET THE TIMER FOR 1 MINUTE.  OR MELT THEM IN THE
OVEN IN A PAN. AT 350 DEGREES.
2.  REMOVE THE MIXTURE AND STIR.  PLACE IT BACK IN THE OVERN FOR 1 1/2
MINUTES OR UNTIL CHOCOLATE CHIPS ARE COMPLETELY MELTED.
3.  ADD THE CHOW MEIN NOODLES.
4.  MIX THE NOODLES BY USING ONE OR TWO FORKS OR SPOONS AS THOUGH YOU
WERE TOSSING A SALAD TO GET THEM EVENLY COATED WITH THE
CHOCOLATE/PEANUT BUTTER MIXTURE.
5.  LAY A PIECE OF WAXED PAPER OVER TWO COOKIE SHEETS.
6.  DROP GOLF-BALL SIZE CLUSTER ON THE COVERED COOKIE SHEET TO COOL
AND SET ADD A FEW COLORED CANDIES (M & M's OR JELLY BEANS) AS "EGGS"
TO THE NESTS!

MIX SUGAR, FLOUR, MILK, BAKING POWDER, EGG, AND SPICE IN A BOWL.
MELT OLEO IN LARGE ENOUGH DISH YOU CAN BAKE IN.  POUR DOUGH OVER OLEO
THEN POUR PEACHES AND JUICE OVER ALL.  DO NOT STIR.  BAKE T 350 FOR
ABOUT 45 MIN OR UNTIL CRUST IS BROWN ON TOP.

Blend softened cheese and margarine in mixer.  Blend and whip in the
sugar. Ready to spread!

Peel, pit and mash avocadoes in medium bowl.  Add lemon juice, salt
and pepper.  In separate bowl, combine sour cream, mayonnaise, and
taco seasoning.  To assemble, spread been dip on a large, shallow
platter.  Top with avocado mixture.  Put on sour cream and taco
mixture.  Sprinkle with chopped onions, tomatoes, and olives.  Cover
with shredded cheese.

Cook and stir hamburger, celery and onion until hamburger is light
brown, then drain.  Pour water on rice and add salt in greased 2 qt
casserole. Stir in hamburger, soup, mushrooms, sugar, soy sauce and
margarine.  Cover and cook in 350f oven for 30min; stir.  Cook
uncovered for 30min longer. Stir in noodles, serve immediately. Note:
Water chestnuts or bamboo shoots may be added if desired.

Combine butter and oil in large frypan and heat.  Add onions and
saute' for one minute.  Add carrots, celery, mushrooms and parsley;
cook, stirring frequently for 5 min.  Crumble in ground beef and
cook, stirring frequently until lightly browned.  Sprinkle flour over
the ground beef and stir until well blended.  Stir in puree.  Add
wine gradually, stirring constantly. Add the broth and season with
spices as desired.  Simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 1 hour
or until thickened.  Serve with pasta. Each serving is about 1 cup of
sauce.

Pre-heat oven to 400f. *** FILLING *** In large skillet, brown
hamburger and drain.  Stir in onion, green pepper, garlic, oregano,
salt water, hot pepper sauce, tomato sauce and sauce mix; simmer
about 10 min, stirring occassionally. *** BATTER *** In a bowl,
combine milk, oil and eggs; beat 1 min on medium speed.  Add flour
and salt; beat 2 min or until smooth. *** ASSEMBLY *** Pour hot meat
mixture into 13x9" pan; top with cheese slices. Pour batter over
cheese, covering filling completely; sprinkle with parmesan cheese.
Bake at 400f for 25-30 min or until puffed and brown.

MIX ALL INGREDIENTS TOGETHER. REFRIDGERATE 3 TO 4 DAYS MIXING WELL
EACH DAY ON THE 3RD OR 4TH DAY SHAPE THE MIXTURE INTO TWO ROLLS. PUT
THE ROLLS ON A RACK. BAKE AT 175 DEGREES FOR 8 HOURS. LEAVE ON THE
RACK UNTIL WELL DRAINED AND COOL. WRAP IN PLASTIC WRAP AND THEN IN
ALUMINUM FOIL . REFRIDGERATE OR FREEZE.

Mix all together except egg. Then beat 1 egg and mix through dough
with fork. This should be real thick.  Drop by spoon on top of
saurkraut and cook 20 min. with cover on.

Cream oleo & sugar.  Add eggs one at a time.  Add bananas and nuts,
mix well.  Add flour sifted with soda.  Bake at 350 for 45 min. for
loaf; about l5 to 20 min. for muffins.  You can also double the batch
and add a large bottle of cherries with a little juice.

Cut up first loaf into small pieces in 9 X 13 greased pan.  Melt
oleo, add brown sugar, milk, pudding mix & cinnamon.  Do not cook.
Pour over cut up pieces.  Cut up second loaf on top of this.  Let
rise till it reaches top of pan.  Bake 1/2 hr. at 350.  Cool 10 min.
Turn out onto cookie sheet. Pecans may be put on bottom of pan.

Boil onions, celery & pepper in chicken broth seasoned with salt,
pepper & red pepper till tender.  Crumble cornbread & bread. Add
mashed boiled eggs. Add broth with vegetables, make it moist but not
soupy.  Bake at 350 about 40-45 min.

Microwave about 15 mins.  Stirring every 4 min.  Add onions when roux
is done.

Grease a large bundt pan.  Sprinkle 1/2 c. nuts in bottom.  Cut
biscuits in quarters & roll each piece in sugar & cinnamon.  Arrange
in pan.  Sprinkle 1/2 c. nuts over biscuits.  Melt oleo, syrup, &
brown sugar.  Pour over buscuits and bake 350 for 30-40 min.  Remove
from pan.  Let cool about 10 min.

name: Kay's All Time Favorite Caramel Rolls
author: Kay McDonald

instructions.content:
Let dough rise until double in bulk.  Brush 10 X 8 or 9 X 9 pan with
1 T. oleo.  Combine 2 T. oleo, 1/4 c. brown sugar, water & corn
syrup.  Spread in pan.  Sprinkle with pecans.  Cover & let rise 30-60
min.  Bake at 375 for 25-30 min.
Roll out dough on floured surface 16 X 12.  Brush with remaining oleo.
Sprinkle with 1/4 c. brown sugar & sprinkle with cinnamon.  Roll.
Cut into 15 or 16 pieces.  Place cut side down in pan.

Mix flour and cooking oil together in heavy oven proof container.
Place on center rack of oven.  Bake 1-1/2 to 2 hrs. at 400 preheated
oven.  stir every 15 min.  It should be caramel color when done.
Remove from oven, cool & freeze enough for 4 gumbos.
Dip tenderized strips in batter and deep fry.

Put flour in large bowl.  Make a hole in center.  Add crisco, boiling
water, salt & egg.  Mix well.  Knead.  Roll a little at a time & cut.
Drop into boiling broth & soup.  Cover, cook on low fire 15 min.

Beat eggs & sugar together.  Add oleo.  Sift dry ingredients & add to
first mixture & blend.  Add nuts & pineapple.  Stir just enough to
combine ingredients.  Pour into greased bread pan.  Bake at 350 for 1
hr.  Serve with butter or cream cheese.

Combine all ingredients and mix well.  Shape into 100 cocktail-size
balls. Bake for 15-20 min. at 350.

list.name: Flour to top ring of sifter

instructions.content: Roll thin.  Cut into squares.  Drop into hot broth.

Mix all together with spoon.  Bake in greased pan.  Bake at 425 for
20 to 25 min.

With electric mixer, cream butter & sugar.  Add egg, molasses & dry
ingredients.  Mix well.  Add hot water & beat well.  Pour batter into
greased & floured 2 lb. coffee can.  Place can in crock pot.  Cover
top of can with 8 paper towels.  Cover & Bake on high 3-4 hrs.  Do
not remove cover or check till the last hour of cooking.  Remove can
& discard towels. Let stand 5 min.  Unmold on cake rack.

Mix together:
1/2 c. sugar. 1 T. salt, 3 T. oleo, 3/4 c. hot water
In another bowl, dissolve 2 pkgs yeast in 1 c. warm water.  Add 1
beaten egg and above mixture.  Add 2 3/4 c. flour.  Mix well.  Add 2
1/2 c. more flour.  Knead for 10 min.  Let rise till double.  Punch
down amd knead 2 min.  Make into rolls or bread and let rise till
double.  Bake about 375 about 15 min.
For Cinnamon Rolls
Roll out dough.  Mix 1/4 c. cinnamon & 3/4 c. sugar.  Melt 1 stick
oleo. Spread oleo on dough.  Sprinkle with cinnamon & sugar.  Roll up
and slice. When done cover with powdered sugar glaze.

Combine eggs, oil and pumpkin with 1/3 cup of water.  Sift dry
ingredients together.  Beat into pumpkin mixture.  Stir in nuts and
cherries.  Pour into greased and floured loaf pan.  Bake at 350 for 1
hour.

Cook squash and onions in salted water until tender; drain; add soup,
sour cream, pimentos and water chestnuts and mix. Set aside. Toss
bread cubes with melted butter . Line bottom of a large greased
casserole dish with 1/2 the bread cubes; Pour all squash mixture over
bread cubes; top with remaining bread cubes. Bake at 350 for 30-40
min. Add cheese and bake 5 more minutes.

Combine potatoes,soup,sour cream & cheese. Spread in 9 x l3 pan; Top
with corn flakes & oleo topping. Bake 1 hour at 350.

Cook vegetables until barely tender. Blend soup, sour cream & onion
soup. Mix and stir into vegetables. Add water chestnuts.Put in 9xl2
dish. Brown rice krispies in oleo and put on top of vegetables.
Cover, Bake 350 for 30 min.

Combine potatoes, white sugar,salt,eggs,4 T oleo,milk & vanilla. Pour
into baking dish. Mix rest of ingredients and sprinkle on top. Bake
at 350 for 40 min.  Sometimes I omit the topping and sprinkle
miniature marshmallows on top when done and brown a little.

Cook broccoli according to pkg. directions, add velveeta.  Saute
onions and celery in oleo, add soup and broccoli mixture.  Put rice
in dish put mixture on top.  bake at 350 for 30 min.

Cream shortening till soft.  Add sugar gradually, then eggs.  Add
molasses & beat till smooth.  Add dry ingredients.  Mix well.  Roll
small balls in sugar.  Bake on an ungreased cookie sheet at 350 for
10-15 min.

Mix first 7 ingredients, fold in egg whites. Pour into baking dish,
place dish in a pan of water. Bake at 325 about an hour or until
a knife comes out clean when inserted.

Saute onion and bell pepper in oleo,add remaining ingredients. Pour
into agreased 9x12 dish. Bake at 350 for 30 min.

Cook broccoli as directed, add cheese. Make a white sauce with oleo,
flour and broth. Add soup and other ingredients. You don't have to
bake it unless you want to heat the whole thing

Saute onion in bacon drippings. Add rest of ingredients. Bake in an
uncovered casserole for 1 1/2 hours at 325

Cook carrots; drain and cool. Mix other ingredients together and pour
over vegetables. Cover and marinate 12 hours or more. Drain to serve.
Will keep 2 weeks in refrigerator.

Mix together all but onions, put into casserole and put onions on
top. Bake 1 hour at 350

Mix all ingredients and simmer 45 min. This can also be done in a
crock pot

Any amount of beans desired may be used. Cover beans with water and
boil 15 min. Drain well. Spread on cookie sheet Put in oven on low
heat for 6 hours turning often. Turn heat off and leave beans in the
oven for 3 or 4 days. Put in jars to store.  Soak over night before
cooking.

Saute onions and pepper in oleo, stir in flour, salt and pepper. Add
milk all at once and bring to a boil stirring constantly.  Reduce
heat and add cheese and mayonaise. Continue stirring till cheese is
melted. Combine sauce and potatoes.  Bake at 350 for 30 min. 2 cups
diced ham may be added to make a meat casserole.
Mix all ingredients together. Bake at 350 for 30 min.

Wash bean mix and place in dutch oven with water to cover overnight.
Drain. Add 2 qts. water and next 4 ingredients; cover and bring to a
boil. Reduce heat and simmer 1 1/2 hours or until beans are tender.
Add rest of ingredients and simmer 30 more minutes stirring
occasionally.

Mix soup together,spread on top of roast. Cover tightly and cook in a
350 oven for 4 hours. Do not look at it or let steam escape during
cooking time.

Brown meat and onion; Drain well. Add rest of ingredients and cook
slowly l5 min. Serve on toasted hamburger buns.

Mix first 8 ingredients together well and put into 2 loaf pans. Bake
at 350 for 30 min. Mix last 3 ingredients together and boil l min.
Baste meat and continue baking for 1 hr. basting again after 30 min.
Be sure and place a tray under the pans to catch any drippings.

Mix all ingredients together except fo bread crumbs. Put in baking
dish and put crumbs on top. Bake 1 hour at 350 or until done.

Cut beef into med size pieces. Melt oleo in skillet, add dried beef
and flour stir a few minutes till smooth then add milk and stir
constantly till thick. Serve over waffles or toast. Add more milk if
it's too thick.

Poke holes is pie crust and partially bake for 5 minutes. Line
partially baked pie crust with peppers. Brown and drain meat and
onion.  Beat eggs then add cheese and browned ground meat and mix
well. Pour into pie crust and bake at 350 for 20 or 25 min.

Cook egg plant in a little oleo with onion. Brown meat and drain. Mix
all ingredients together and heat.

Work as much flour as possible into meat; season to taste. Brown meat
and onion and drain any grease off. Add water and simmer covered for
45 min. Add rest of ingredients and cook l5 more min.

Mix first 3 ingredients together. Put sticks in weiners. Keep batter
and weiners cold. Twist weiners while in batter and when pulling out.
Deep fry.

Place meat, onions, celery and carrots in casserole. Blend salt,
tapioca and sugar and sprinkle over meat and vegetables. Cover with
potatoes. Add juice. Cover with foil. Bake at 300 for 4 hours.

Cut diamonds on top of ham and stick cloves in at intersections of
cuts. Mix orange juice, nutmeg, brown sugar, ginger, cloves and
mustard. Bring to a boil and stir till sugar is dissolved then add
brandy. Punch holes in ham with fork and marinate with sauce at least
4 hours in refrigerator . Bake at 325 till done (15 minutes per
pound). Keep ham basted while marinating and baking (every 30
minutes) . Add a little water to corn starch then lemon
juice,dissolve well then add to drippings in pan. Serve over ham.

Mix verything together except for soup and water. Make into balls the
size of walnuts. Brown in oil; drain well. Mix soup and water
together and pour over meat balls. Simmer covered about 20 min.

Season meat and brown with onion and celery. Drain well. Mix with rest
ingredients. heat at 350 till warm through.

Brown meat and drain well. Mix all ingredients together. Bake covered
for 1 hr at 400. Uncover and if it's too dry add more broth or water
and bake a few more min. uncovered.

Brown meat and onion and drain well. Mix all ingredients together and
bake at 350 for 30 min.

Saute onion, celery and bell pepper in a little butter. Add soups,
chicken broth, Rotel and Velveeta.  Heat till cheese is melted and
vegetables are tender. Add chicken and olives and serve over
vermacelli cooked according to package directions.  I use rotisserie
chicken but can chicken will work or you can boil a fryer and use
that and its chicken broth.

Saute onions, celery, bell pepper and parsley in oleo. Add rest of the
ingredients. Bake in greased casserole dish for 30 min. at 350.

Place 2 c. fritos in baking dish, put onion and half of cheese over
the chips. Next put chili then rest of chips and cheese.  Bake at 350
for l5 or 20 min.

Saute onions, celery and bell pepper in oleo. Add water chestnuts and
pimento then all of the soup and mix well. Add the half and half and
1 cup of the cheese. Add chicken and rice and mix well. Put into a
greased baking dish. Bake at 350 for 25 min. Put rest of cheese on
top and return to oven for 5 min or until cheese is melted. This can
be put in 2 pans and one frozen for a later time.

Pound each half of chicken breast until flat, place one slice dried
beef on top; roll up like jelly roll, tuck in loose ends; wrap with 1
slice bacon,fasten with tooth pick if necessary; place in 9x12 pan.
Mix soup and sour cream; spoon over chicken breasts.  Let stand
overnight or can be frozen for a later time. Bake uncovered 3 hours
at 275-300.  Serve with rice. If it begins to look dry cover with
foil.

Combine everything but cheese; put into greased 9x12 dish; Bake at
350 for 35 min. Put cheese on top and return to oven for 5 min or
until cheese is melted.

Saute onion, celery and bell pepper in oleo till tender. Add tomatoes
and worcerstershier sauce. Add uncooked shrimp and cook till tender.
Just before done add a little flour to thicken if desired. Serve over
rice.

Blend cheeses, onion flakes and parsley flakes with mixer. Refrigerate
for 1 hour then form into 2 balls and roll in nuts.  Can be frozen.

Mix beet juice, vinegar, sugar, salt and pepper and bring to a boil.
Pour over eggs and beets and let stand over night.

Melt oleo in shallow pan in 250 oven. Add rest of ingredients and
stir well to coat evenly. Heat in oven 45 min. Stir every 15 min.
Spread on absorbant paper to cool.

Blend avacado, mayonaise and cr cheese together till smooth. Spread on
platter and chill about 2 hrs. Top with remaining ingredients, add hot
sauce if desired; serve with chips.

list.name: Cooked and cut up crab meat

instructions.content:
Melt cheeses in double boiler. Saute onion in oleo and add to cheese.
Season with worcestershire, tobasco, salt, pepper and garlic powder as
desired. Add crab meat. Serve warm.

Mix pudding and jello together; add boiling water, stir till all is
dissolved. Cool slightly; add oranges. Chill till almost set then
fold in cool whip.

Drain juice off of the fruit. Whip pudding and milk till thick; mix
with fruit and cool whip; chill.

Mix can of undrained pineapple with pudding mix, stir well. Fold in
cool whip then add pecans and marshmallows. Chill at least 1 hr before
serving.

Dissolve strawberry jello in 1 1/2 c boiling water; add strawberries
an stir until completely thawed. Put in dish and chill till set.
Dissolve lemon jello in 1 c boiling water; add pineapple juice and
let cool then blend in softened cr cheese; add pineapple and chill
till thichened. Fold in cool whip then pour over strawberry layer
after it's set. Chill well.

Prepare jello according to directions and chill till set. Cut into
cubes and mix with other ingredients.
Combine all ingredients and chill well.

Grind cranberries and apples together. Stir water and jello till
dissolved. Add cranberry apple mixture, sugar, pineapple and 1 c
pecans. Chill. Mix softened cr cheese with cool whip and spread on
top; sprinkle with pecans.

Dissolve jello in boiling water and add seven-up; cool till jelled.
Add pineapple, marshmallows and bananas, put in 9x12 pan. Make
topping by cooking eggs, sugar, cornstarch and pineapple juice till
thick add oleo and let cool. Add cool whip and spread on top of first
layer. Sprinkle cheese on top.

Mix water and jello till dissolved; beat in cr cheese and add
pineapple juice. Chill till set. Add drained pineapple, celery,
cherries and pecans. Fold in cool whip. Chill.
Mix all together; chill and serve.

Make a sauce with miracle whip, sugar, lemon juice and enough milk to
make it creamy. Mix with vegetables and chill.

Stir jello in boiling water till dissolved, add grape juice and chill
till set. add pineapple and pecans. Make topping by mixing cr. cheese
and mayonaise together; fold in cool whip and spread over jello layer.

Stir jello in boiling water till dissolved, add pineapple with juice
and pie filling. Put in 9x12 dish and chill till firm. Make a topping
with cr. cheese, sour cream, sugar, and vanilla. Spread on top of
jello layer and sprinkle with pecans. Also good with cherry jello and
cherry pie filling.

Cook and drain vegetables. Mix dry dressing mix with mayonaise; add
to vegetables, bell pepper, celery and olives. refrigerate over night
and add onions before serving.

Brown meat and drain. Add taco seasioning mix according to pkg.
directions. Mix with remaining ingredients and serve with favorite
dressing.

Put lettuce in 9x12 dish, then green pepper. Next put the celery, then
onions and peas. Mix mayonaise and milk and spread on top; sprinkle
with sugar. Put crumbled bacon and grated cheese on top. Cover
tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate over night.

Put lettuce in 9x12 dish, next put celery, then onion, next green
pepper. Add chopped eggs, then peas. Mix sour cream and mayonaise and
spread on top Sprinkle with bacon and cheese. Cover with plastic wrap
and refrigerate over night.
Boil everything together for 1 min.
Mix everything together well.

Mix water and milk in pan and bring to a boil. Put grease in a
skillet and mix in flour, salt and pepper; stir till rue is brown.
Pour rue into milk and water, stirring constantly till desired
thickness.

Cook mashed figs on a low fire until heated through, then add sugar
and jello. Let it come to a boil then cook for 15 min. Pour into hot
canning jars and seal.

Wash and remove peel from oranges; add 1 qt. water to peel and boil 5
min. drain and discard water. Add another quart of water and boil 5
more min. drain and discard water. Grind peel and peeled oranges
together. Wash pears; remove core; cut into small pieces. Combine
oranges, pears, and pineapple. Measure and add half as much sugar
then add lemon juice and mix. Cook over med. heat till thick about 40
min. stirring occasionally. Add cherries and cook 5 more min. Put
into hot canning jars and seal.

Put washed figs in large pot. Put sugar on top over low fire. When
juice is formed stir and continue cooking till figs are preserved and
thin syrup is made. Put into canning jars and seal. Any amount can be
cooked at a time using half as much sugar as figs.

Tie spices in a cheeze cloth. Cook peeled and halved peaches in syrup
made from remaining ingredients until tender and clear. Remove
peaches from syryp and put into canning jars. Boil syrup down for a
little while and fill jars and seal.

Mix everything together and add enough milk to make about 1/2 gal.
Freeze in ice cream freezer. Two cans of chopped up peaches may be
added or any other fruit.
Pour into ice cream freezer and turn till stiff.

Grease and flour 9x12 dish and sprinkle brown sugar and pecans on
bottom. Mix rest of the ingredients together and pour into dish. Bake
at 350 for 40 min. TOPPING: 1 c sugar, 8 T oleo, 1/2 c can milk, 1 t
vanilla. Combine ingredients together and cook 1 min after coming to
a boil. Pour over cake while hot.

Put cake mix in bowl with sugar; make a well and put oil and sour
cream in the middle. Mix slowly. Add eggs one at a time. Pour half
the batter into a greased and floured bundt pan. Make a mixture with
the brown sugar, cinnamon and pecans and spread over batter in pan;
top with remaining batter. Bake at 350 for 1 hr. Do not open oven
while cooking.

Beat oleo till creamy. Add sugar and beat well. Add eggs one at a
time. Add flour and vanilla and mix well. Put into a greased and
floured bundt pan and bake at 350 for 45 min. or 1 hr.

Put sugar and flour into large mixing bowl. Melt oleo, cocoa, crisco
and water together and pour over dry ingredients. Stir well. Add
buttermilk soda and vanilla. Mix well. Bake in greased and floured
9x15 pan for 20 min. at 400. FROSTING: 8 T oleo, 3 1/2 T cocoa, 1/3 c
milk & 1 box powdered sugar. Bring oleo, milk and cocoa to a boil add
powdered sugar and mix well. Spread over hot cake. Sprinkle pecans on
top.

Sift dry ingredients together. Blend oil and sugar thoroughly. Add
eggs and vanilla and mix well. Add dry ingredients and mix well. fold
in carrots, pineapple and pecans. Bake in a greased and floured bundt
pan for 1 1/4 hrs. at 350. GLAZE: 3/4 c powdered sugar, 1 T orange
juice Mix well and spread on cake.

Mix all together and Bake in 3 greased and floured cake pans for 25
min. at 350. ICING: 1/2 box of frozen strawberries and juice, 2 T
oleo and 1 Box powdered sugar. Mix well and put between layers and on
top.

Cream oleo, add sugar and mix well. Add eggs one at a time. Add dry
ingredients and mix well. Bake in a greased and floured bundt pan for
1 1/2 to 2 hrs. at 275.

Cream oleo and sugar till fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating
well. Add dry ingredients alternately with milk. Stir in lemon juice
and peel. Bake in a greased and floured bundt pan for 70-75 min. at
325. GLAZE:  Combine 1/3 c melted oleo, 2 c powdered sugar and 2 T
lemon juice Beat till smooth. Thin with 1 or 2 t hot water if
necessary.
Combine all ingredients and bake at 350 for 1 hr.
Bake 1 hr. 45 min at 300.

Pour hot water on dates and soda and let cool. Beat eggs, sugar and
oleo. Mix nuts in dry ingredients, add to creamed mixture.  Add date
mixture. Bake in greased and floured pan 1 hr. at 300.

Cream sugar and wesson oil; sift flour once, add salt, soda, baking
powder and cinnamon and sift all together. Add carrots and flour
alternately. Add eggs one at a time. Add nuts and bake at 350 for 45
min.

Stir cream cheese till very soft; blend in 1/2 c milk. Add remaining
milk and pudding mix and beat slowly till well mixed. Pour into
crust. Sprinkle graham cracker crumbs lightly over top

Beat well after each addition. Bake slowly in 9x12 pan. when done cut
into squares and glaze.
GLAZE:  1/2 box powdered sugar and enough lemon juice to spread.

Mix crumbs and butter. Save 2/3 c for top. Spread rest in a 9x12 dish.
Put softened ice cream over crumbs. Top with fudge topping then cool
whip. Sprinkle with crumbs and freeze till ready to serve.  It's
easier if you freeze each layer before adding the next.

Mix all togrether; Bake in greased and floured bundt pan at 300 for
about 1-1 1/2 hrs. or till done.
Bake in greased and floured 9x12 pan for 20 or 30 min at 350.

Melt chocolate chips, milk, 2 T oleo and 1/2 t salt in top of double
boiler When smooth add nuts and 2 t vanilla; Cream 1 c oleo and sugar
till light and fluffy. Mix in eggs and 2 t vanilla. Sift dry
ingredients. Stir in oatmeal. Blend dry ingredients into creamed
mixture. Put 2/3 of oatmeal mixture in bottom of 9x12 pan cover with
chocolate mixture and dot with remaining oatmeal mixture. Bake at 350
for 25-30 min.

Prepare cake mix according to directions and bake in a greased and
floured l5x10x1 pan. When done pour pineapple on top. Mix pudding mix
with cream cheese and put on top. Cover with cool whip and sprinkle
pecans on top.

Mix sugar, oil, eggs, flour, salt, vanilla and cocoa together and add
pecans. Bake in 9x12 pan for 30 min at 350. Immediately spread
marshmallow cream on top. Cool completely. ICING: Mix oleo, powdered
sugar, cocoa, eagle brand and vanilla together well. Add pecans and
spread on well cooled cake.

Cream sugar, oleo, egg and vanilla well. Dissolve soda in 2 T hot
water add this and applesauce and stir in. Add sifted dry ingredients
and mix well. Pecans and raisins may be added if desired. Bake 1 hr
at 350.

Bake cake according to directions. Make pudding with Milk. Alternate
ingtedients in a punch bowl. Top with cherries, pecans and coconut.

Mix cake mix, 1 egg and oleo well. Spread in9x12 pan lightly greased.
Mix cr cheese, powdered sugar and 2 eggs. Pour over cake batter.
Bake at 350 for 35-40 min.

name: Kay's Brownie Bars with Caramel Filling
author: Kay McDonald

instructions.content:
Combine caramels and 1/3 c can milk in top of double boiler and melt.
Keep warm. Combine cake mix, oleo and 1/3 c can milk in a bowl, beat
2 min. Spread 1/2 batter in greased 9x12 pan. Bake at 350 for 6 min.
Cool 2 min. Spread caramel mixture carefully over baked layer.
Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Stir 1/2 c nuts into remaining batter.
Drop by spoonfulls over top. Sprinkle with 1/2 c nuts Bake at 350 for
18 min.

Melt caramels in 1/3 c can milk in top of double boiler; add pecans.
Spread 1/2 of batter in a greased and floured 9x12 dish. Bake at 350
for 6 min. Sprinkle chips on top then melted caramels. Next put
remaining dough on top. Bake at 350 for 15 min.

Combine all ingredients in a large mixing bowl; mix well and pour
into a lightly greased 17x11 pan. Bake at 350 for 20-25 min. Cool
well before frosting.

ICING:
Combine cr. cheese,oleo, powdered sugar and vanilla and milk;
beat till smooth. Spread on cooled cake.

Combine crisco, salt, baking powder. Add eggs one at a time beating
well after each one. Add vanilla then flour and sour cream. Add
cherry juice and beat well.  Fold in cherries and nuts.  Pour into a
greased and floured bundt pan.  Bake at 375 for 1 hr.

Beat oleo at high speed till fluffy.  Add eggs one at a time.
Gradually beat in sugar.  By hand stir in flour, frosting mix and
pecans until blended.  Bake in a greased and floured bundt pan  at
350 for 55 to 60 min. Cool in the pan for 2 hrs.

Cream sugar and oleo.  Add eggs and beat well.  Add dry ingredients
alternately with apple sauce.  Add raisins and nuts.  Bake in l5x10
pan at 375 for 20 or 25 min.

Cream crisco and sugar till light and fluffy.  Add eggs and vanilla;
beat well.  Combine flour, cocoa, soda and salt; blend into creamed
mixture. Stir in chips.  Drop on ungreased sheet and bake at 350 for
8 or 9 min. Cool slightly before removing from pan.

Combine all ingredients in a large pan. Melt almond bark in micro
wave. Pour over mixture and mix thoroughly so that everything is
coated. Spread out on wax paper real thin to dry. Separate and store
in air tight container.
To toast pecans put in microwave oven 6 min, stir and toast about 6
more min.

In large bowl, blend oil and sugars on low until well mixed.  Add
vanilla. Beat in eggs, one at a time, blending well after each
addition.  Stir together dry ingredients and add to egg mixture until
well blended.  Stir in walnuts and carrots by hand.
Pour batter into well greased and floured 10" tube pan or fluted pan.
Bake at 350f for 50-60 minutes.  Cool in pan, then top with powdered
sugar or frosting of your choice.

Using garlic press, squeeze pulp and juice into softened cheese.
Cream with a spoon until smooth.  Gradually add the remaining
ingredients, blending until smooth.  For thinner dip, add more clam
broth. Serve with crackers, chips or veggies.

Combine water, sugar and corn syrup in saucepan.  Cook and stir 2
minutes or until sugar is dissolved.  Puree kiwi in food processor or
blender to equal 3/4 cup puree.  Add lemon juice, peel and sugar mix.
Pour into shallow metal pan and freeze for approximately 1 hour or
until the mixture is firm, but not solid.  When chilled, spoon into a
chilled bowl and beat with an electric mixer until the mix is light
and fluffy.  Return it to the freezer for approximately 2 hours or
until firm enough to scoop.

Heat oven to 375f.  Grease cookie sheet.
In large bowl, beat together butter, brown sugar and 3/4 cup
granulated sugar until light and fluffy.  Add eggs; mix well.  In
medium bowl, combine flour, oats, 1 t cinnamon, soda and salt.  Add
to sugar mixture; mix well. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto
prepared cookie sheet.  In small bowl, combine remaining 1 T sugar
and 1 t cinnamon; sprinkle lightly over each cookie.  Bake 8-10
minutes.  Cool 1 minute on cookie sheet; remove to wire cooling rack.

Combine sugar, margarine, and milk in heavy 2.5qt saucepan; bring to
full rolling bowl, stirring constantly.  Continue boiling 5 min over
medium heat or until candy thermometer reaches 234f stirring
constantly to prevent scorching.  Remove from heat; stir in chips
until melted.  Add marshmallow creme, nuts and vanilla; beat until
well blended.  Pour into greased 9x13" pan.  Cool at room
temperature, cut into squares. One serving is approximately 2 oz.

Stir together flour, baking powder, salt and seeds.  In large bowl,
beat together orange juice, honey, eggs and cereal.  Let stand 2 min.
Add flour mixture, stirring only until well combined.  Spread evenly
in greased 8.5 x 4.5 x 2" loaf pan.  Bake at 350f about 40 min.  Let
cool 10 min and remove from pan.  Cool completely before slicing.

Preheat oven to 325f.
Heat fat in a deep heavy pot.  Cook the onions, peppers, and garlic
until the onions are limp and transparent and paprika has lost its
raw taste. Add beef and remaining ingredients except sour cream.
Stir well to combine.  Simmer in preheated oven for 1 1/2 to 2 hours
or until the meat is tender.  Adjust oven temperature during cooking
time so contents of pot remain at a simmer.  Serve in shallow soup
bowls with a tablespoon of sour cream atop each serving.
Pour over ice cubes in old-fashioned cocktail glass.

Shake with ice and strain into old-fashioned glass over ice cubes.
A wedge of lime may be added.

Rub rim of cocktail glass with rind of lemon or lime, dip rim in salt.
Shake ingredients with ice and strain into salt-rimmed glass.

Shake with ice and strain into sour glass.  Decorate with a
half-slice of lemon and a cherry.

Grease 9x5x3" loaf pan.
Mix flour, salt, baking power; combine with beer and honey in large
bowl. Stir together until well mixed.  Spread batter in prepared pan.
Bake at 350f for 45 min or until browned and a wooden pick comes out
clean.  Turn out on cooling rack.  Cool completely before slicing.

In small bowl stir together bran cereal and boiling water.  In large
bowl combine oats, flour, sugar, soda and salt - set aside.  In small
bowl combine remaining ingrediants unitl well blended.  Add liquid
ingrediants all at once to oat mixture stirring until just moistened.
Gently stir cooled bran mixture.  Fill greased or paper lined muffin
pans 2/3 full. Bake at 400 for 15-20 minutes.

Cream crisco until fluffy, add sugar and cream until light and fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time beating well after each.  Stir in vanilla.
Sift dry ingrediants and gradually add to creamed mixture.  Chill
dough thoroughly 3 to 4 hours.  On well floured surface roll dough
1/8 inch thick.  Cut with cookie cutters.  Bake on ungreased cookie
sheet in 375 oven for 6 to 8 minutes.  Cool on rack.

Dry bread slices in oven and blend in blender to make bread crumbs.
Toast almonds for about 5 minutes at 325.  Melt soup, cheese and
chicken stock in saucepan.  Blend in chicken and drained green beans.
Grease casserole dish and put in bread crumbs.  Pour saucepan mixture
on top of bread crumbs. Heat at 350 for 40 minutes.  Remove from
oven, put extra shredded cheese and toasted almonds on top.  Return
to oven for 15 to 20 more minutes.

Cream butter or margarine and sugar until light and fluffy.  Add eggs
and vanilla beat one minute at medium speed.  Combine flour, cocoa,
baking soda and salt, add alternately with water to cream mixture.
Pour batter into 2 greased and floured cake pans.  Bake at 350 35-40
minutes for 8 inch pans. Bake 30-35 minutes for 9 inch pans.  Cool
for 10 minutes, remove from pans. Cool and frost.  Use Chocolate
Buttercream frosting - see frosting recipe.

Combine cocoa and sugar in bowl.  Cream butter with 1/2 cup cocoa
mixture in small bowl.  Add remaining cocoa mixture alternately with
milk beating to spread consistency.  Blend in vanilla.  Makes 2 cups.

Saute onion and celery in butter, add to rice, broccoli, soup, milk
and cheese.  Light cover with shredded Velvetta. Bake 30 minutes at
350 uncovered.

Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until dough pulls away from
sides of pan.  Knead 5 times and store in plastic bags.

Melt Philly cream cheese and tomato soup together in double boiler.
Then mix with Knox gelatin & water - set this aside to cool.  Then
add mayo, shrimp, onion, celery and green pepper, mix all together.
Chill - best when chilled overnight.

Brown ground beef and garlic together - drain .  Add tomatoe sauce,
tomatoes and seasonings, simmer 30 minutes.  Cook noodles per pkg
directions, slightly undercooked, drain.  Lightly grease bottom of
9X13 pan.  Cover bottom with:
1. 1 1/2 cup beef & tomatoe mix.
2. Lay 1/2 noodles evenly in dish until mix is covered. (5 noodles)
3. Spread 1/2 cottage cheese over noodles.
4. Sprinkle 1/2 parmesan cheese over cottage cheese. (1/4 cup)
5. Cover with 1/3 mozarella or swiss.
Repeat
Top with remaining beef & tomatoe mix & last 1/3 of cheese.  Bake at
350 45 minutes.  Let stand 15 minutes before cutting.

Cut chicken breasts into 2 X 1/4 inch strips.  In wok or 10 inch
skillet heat 1 1/2 tsps oil over high heat; add chicken and cook,
stirring quickly and frequently until lightly browned on all sides, 2
to 3 minutes.  Remove from pan and set aside.  To same pan add
remaining 1 1/2 tsps oil and heat; add celery, carrot, broccoli,
garlic and gingeroot and stir fry until vegetables are tender crisp,
2 to 3 minutes.  Add mushrooms and scallions and continue to stir-fry
1 to 2 minutes; add cabbage, bean sprouts and water chestnuts and
stir fry 1 to 2 minutes longer.  Combine broth, cornstarch, stirring
to dissolve cornstarch.  Add to vegetable mixture along with soy
sauce and cook, stirring constantly, until sauce is thickened, 2 to 3
minutes.  Return chicken to pan and cook until chicken is heated
through, about 1 minute longer. Each serving is: 4 protein, 1/2
bread, 4 1/4 vegetable, 1 1/2 fat 25 cal optional, 392 cal per serving
NOTE: TRIED THIS RECIPE ONCE AND DIDN'T CARE FOR IT

Cream until well blended
For chocolate add 1/2 cup cocoa and 1 TPBS more water

Cream shortening and sugar together, add eggs and mix till smooth.
Add peanut butter and stir well then add dry ingrediants and vanilla.
Form into balls, press criss cross with fork dipped in a mixture of
sugar and flour.  Bake 350 about 10 minutes.

Drain pears reserving 1 cup juice.  Bring juice to a boil and add
jello. Chill

Cook oleo, sugar and karo until caramel color about 12 minutes after
coming to a boil.  Add 1 tsp vanilla.  Pour over popped corn and
nuts, coat evenly, when cool break apart and store in an air tight
jar.

Mix dry ingrediants.  Add honey, vinegar, lemon juice and onion.  Add
oil into the mixture very slowly, beating constantly.  Yields 2 cups.
Combinations of: nectarines, peaches, oranges, bananas, cantelope,
santa rosa plums, melon etc.

Mix sugar, margarine and milk.  Bring to a boil and cook for 3
minutes. Remove from stove and stir in marshmallow creme, peanut
butter and vanilla. Pour into buttered 8X8 inch pan and cool.

Cook milnot, sugar, salt and egg yolks until thick (stir with swirl
whip). Add butter & set aside for about 5 minutes until slightly
cooled.  Stir in vanilla, pecans & coconut.  Spread on cooled cake.

Heat together chocolate, shortening and milk until melted.  Blend in
sugar, salt & vanilla.  Stir until thick enough to spread
successfully. Tip: If necessary to thicken, stir over ice water. To
thin, stir over hot water.

Cream Crisco with mixer beaters until creamy.  Add salt and mix.  Add
other ingrediants and beat until well blended.

In 3 quart saucepan over medium - high heat cook ground beef and
onions until meats browned and onions tender, about 10 minutes,
stirring occassionally.  Stir in kidney beans,tomato sauce, sugar,
thyme, pepper and 1 tsp salt; over high heat, heat to boiling.
Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer 10 minutes to blend flavors.
Meanwhile halve green peppers, discard seeds, place peppers in 12
inch skillet.  Add 1/2 inch of water and 1 tsp salt; over high heat,
heat to boiling.  Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 5 minutes or
until tender crisp - Drain.  In cup mix cornstarch  and 1/2 cup water
gradually stir into meat mixture.  Cook over medium heat until
mixture is slightly thickened.  To serve place peppers cut side up on
warm platter.  Spoon meat mixture into green pepper, sprinkle with
shredded cheddar cheese.

Add sugar and water to Cherry or Strawberry Koolaid as directed on
package. Mix sweetend Koolaid, 1/2 small box of Cherry or Strawberry
Jello, and 1 large can of Dole pineapple juice together and freeze in
3 or 4 containers. Set out of freezer 4 or 5 hours before needed.
Mash up with large spoon. Add 1 large bottle of Canada Dry Ginger Ale
or 7Up.  Add Ginger Ale or 7Up about 30 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 (325 for glass dish).  In 13X9-inch baking pan,
melt margarine in oven.  Sprinkle crumbs over margarine;pour Eagle
Brand evenly over crumbs.  Top with remaining ingredients; press down
firmly.  Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly browned.  Cool.
Chill thoroughly if desired.  Cut into bars.  Store loosely covered
at room temperature.

In heavy saucepan, over low heat, melt chips with Eagle Brand.  Remove
from heat; stir in remaining ingredients.  Spread evenly into wax
paper- lined 8-inch square pan.  Chill 2 hours or until firm.  Turn
fudge onto cutting board; peel off paper and cut into squares.  Store
loosely covered at room temperature.  (Makes about 2 pounds)

White Confetti Fudge: In heavy saucepan, melt 1 1/2 pounds white
chocolate with Eagle Brand; remove from heat.  Stir in 1/8 teaspoon
salt, 1 teaspoon vanilla and 1 cup chopped candied cherries.  Proceed
as directed. (Makes about 2 1/2 pounds)

Boil 1/2 cup brown sugar, 2 cups water and 1 Tablespoon of butter
until dissolved and pour into square pan.  Mix together remaining
ingredients and drop into dissolved mixture.  Bake 25 minutes at 350.

Whisk the egg yolks until thick and lemon colored.  Whisk in the
sweetened condensed milk and lime juice.  Pour into crust.  Beat the
egg whites and cream of tartar until foamy.  Gradually add the sugar,
about a tablespoon at a time, beating until meringue will hold stiff
peaks.  Spread meringue over the filling, making sure to seal
completely to edges of pie crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes
or until meringue is golden brown.  Cool to room temperature, then
chill at least 1 hour before serving.

Whisk the egg yolks with the sweetened condensed milk and lime juice.
Beat the egg whites to the stiff peak stage.  Fold the whites into
the lime mixture.  Pour into crust and bake 10 minutes at 350
degrees.  Let cool to room temperature, then chill at least 1 hour
before serving.  Beat the whipping cream to soft peaks, then beat in
vanilla and sugar.  Spoon on individual slices of pie before serving.

name: Cauley Square Tea Room Key Lime Pie
author: Unknown

instructions.content:
Whip egg yolks and blend with condensed milk.  Add key lime juice,
mixing only until juice is mixed in.  Do not over beat.  Pour into 9
inch baked pie shell or prepared graham cracker pie crust.  Chill
until set (overnight is best).  Top with whipped cream if you like.
For a deeper filling make one and one-half times the above recipe.
8-10 limes squeezed produces appr. 1/2 cup of lime juice.

Cauley Square Tea Room is part of historic Cauley Square located
between Homestead and Miami in Florida.

Sprinkle pork with above spices and sit 1/2 to 2 hours in refrigerator
before grilling.  For Chicken use poultry seasoning instead of garlic
salt. Cook both sides of meat before basting with BBQ sauce.
Continue to cook basting with BBQ sauce.

Drain strawberries and save juice (should be 1/2 cup juice).  Mix
sugar and cornstarch together with pinch of salt, then stir in juice
and water. Boil until thickened, stirring constantly.  Remove from
heat and cool about 10 minutes.  Add lemon juice and drained berries.
Let cool.  Line baked pie shell with banana slices add strawberry
filling.  Chill in refrigerator at least 2 hours.  Spread with cool
whip or whipping cream.

Spread pie filling on bottom of 9X13 pan.  Sprinkle white cake mix on
top. Top with melted oleo and chopped nuts.  Bake at 350 for 50-60
minutes.

Beat 1 package of dream whip according to directions.  Mix 1 cup of
dream whip, 1 small package of vanilla instant pudding and 2/3 cup of
milk.  Stir or beat about 1 minute or until well mixed.  Add pumpkin
and cinnamon. Pour into graham cracker or ready baked crust.  Top
with remaining dream whip.  Chill 2 hours.

In medium bowl, blend 1 envelope Lipton Vegetable Recipe Soup Mix, 1
pint (16oz) sour cream, 1/2 cup mayonnaise and 1/2 teaspoon lemon
juice.  Stir in 1 package (10oz) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and
squeezed dry, and 1 can (8oz) water chestnuts, drained and chopped;
chill.  Makes about 3 cups dip.

Day before serving, rub all sides of meat with salt, pepper and garlic
powder.  Place in shallow pan.  Mix 1 pkg. Liptons onion soup with 1
cup water.  Pour over meat and add water to make 1/2".  Cover with
foil.  Bake at 250 for 1 hour per pound.  Remove cover, let cool in
juice. Refrigerate.  On serving day slice meat very thin on the
diagonal.  Arrange slices on platter.  Cover with mushrooms that have
been sauteed in butter and some of the meat juices.  Cover with foil.
Heat through about 1 hour. Garnish with parsley and 1 can whole small
onions.  About 7 lbs of meat serves 12.

Rub the entire brisket with prepared mustard.  Sprinkle and rub in
some Worcestershire sauce and Tex-Joy steak seasoning.  Place brisket
in a 450 - 500 oven for 5-10 minutes.  Reduce heat to 200 and leave
in over night.  Cover with foil the next morning and continue baking
for a total of 12 hours.  (Use a shallow pan with rack). (Last 5
hours covered with foil) (miniumum of 12 hours cooking time)

Sift 2 cups of flour and 1 tsp of salt together.  Take out 1/3 cup of
this mixture and place in small bowl with 1/4 cup water.  Stir to
make a paste. Add 2/3 cup crisco to rest of flour, dropping in
criscoe pieces at a time, mixing with fingers until consistency of
coarse corn meal.  Add flour paste - form into 2 balls.  Roll out to
make two pie crusts. Bake at 400 for 12-15 minutes.  Check at 12
minutes.

Melt 20 or more large marshmallows with 1/3 cup milk and 1 large (8oz)
Hershey bar in double boiler.  Let cool.  Fold in one teaspoon
vanilla and 1 cup cool whip.  Fill baked pie crust.  Chill.  Spread
cool whip on top and sprinkle with grated small chocolate bar.

Combine granulated sugar, powdered sugar, oleo and oil.  Add eggs and
beat again.  Sift dry ingredients together and add gradually mixing
well.  Drop small balls of dough on cookie sheet.  Bake at 375 for
10-12 minutes.

Combine tomato sauce, chili powder, cumin and salt; mix well.  Brown
chuck
and onions and garlic; drain excess fat.  Add olives, chilies and 1
1/2 cup tomato sauce.  Boil gently, uncovered, 15-20 minutes.  Fry
tortillas quickly on both sides in hot oil, drain on paper towels.
To prepare stacks:
Layer 6 tortillas alternately with meat mixture and cheese in 9 inch
pie plate using about 1/4 cup meat mixture and 3 tablespoons cheese
between each tortilla and on top of stack.  Repeat procedure for
second stack. Pour remaining sauce over stacks.  Cover loosely with
aluminum foil.  Bake
in moderate oven at 375 for 25 to 30 minutes.  Cut each stack into
wedges to serve.
May be made ahead and refrigerated for several hours or over night.
Bake at 375 for  40-45 minutes.
Microwave:
Omit foil.  Microwave 6 minutes on high, rotate 1/2 turn every 2
minutes.

Cook macaroni, drain and rinse in cold water.  Mix ingrediants adding
miracle whip until moist.

Combine flour, butter, and pecans and put in 8X8 inch dish.  Bake at
350 for 25 minutes and then cool.  Whip cream cheese, powdered sugar
and cool whip together and pour into cooled crust.  Refrigerate for a
few hours. Prepare instant chocolate pudding as directed on package
and pour on top of cream cheese layer.  Refrigerate several hours
before serving.

name: Oven Bar B Q Chicken and Bar B Q Links
author: Carol Findley

instructions.content:
Place 2 cut up chickens in 9X12 dish.  If only 1 chicken is used a
smaller dish may be used.  Salt and pepper to taste.  Cover with Bar
B Q Sauce. Cover dish with foil and bake at 400 an hour or till
chicken is done. Serve over rice.

Bar B Q Links
Cook links on grill.  Baste with sauce before serving.

Mix thoroughly surag and shortening.  Blend in 1 egg.  Sift together
flour, baking powder and salt.  Stir in alternately with 1 cup of
milk. Bake 20 to 23 minutes at 375.

One of the specialties of Mrs. K's Toll House, Silver Springs
Maryland.

Sprinkle sliced cucumbers with 1 teaspoon of salt and let stand for 10
minutes.  Press out excess liquid.  Combine 1/2 teaspoon sugar,
1 tablespoon parsley, 1 cup of sour cream, 2 tablespoons of vinegar,
1 teaspoon of salt and 2 tablespoons of minced onion.  Mix with
cucumbers. Sprinkle 1/8 teaspoon of paprika on top.

Break up raw hamburger into ungreased baking dish.  Sprinkle with
onion salt and garlic salt sparingly.  Mix soup and milk, pour over
meat.  Bake covered at 350 for 40 to 45 minutes.  Take from the oven
and break meat apart with fork.  Sprinkle on shoestring potatoes or 2
slices of buttered bread crumbs.  Bake another 10 minutes uncovered.

Put in 9X13 pan overnight and freeze.  Bake 350 covered for 1 1/2
hours. Use 2 cups of tuna, chicken, turkey, crab or shrimp.

list.name: Lg pkg thawed hash brown pot

instructions.content:
Mix ingrediants together well and put in baking dish.  Sprinkle with
sesame seeds and a little paprika.  Bake uncovered at 300 for 1 1/2
hours.

Mix mustard, salt and pepper.  Sprinkle over meat.  Pound seasonings
into both sides of meat.  In heavy skillet, brown meat on both sides
in oil. Remove from heat; skim off fat.  Drain mushrooms, saving
liquid.  Add water to make 1/2 cup.  Add Worcestershire sauce and
pour over meat.  Cover and simmer 1 1/4 - 1 1/2 hrs.  Add mushrooms.
Heat through.  Remove meat to platter.  Spoon excess fat from pan
juices.  Pour juices and mushrooms over meat and serve.

In medium bowl, combine shredded skinned cooked chicken, beans and
shredded cheese.  Line serving bowl with lettuce; mound chicken
mixture in center. Border with medium tomato cut into 8 wedges.  Top
with Mexican dressing and toss.

Mexican Dressing
In medium bowl combine 1/2 cup plain low-fat yogurt, 1/2 cup sliced
scallions, 1 1/2 teaspoons mayonnaise, 1/4 cup chopped drained canned
green chilies, 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin, 1/8 teaspoon chili powder,
and pinch salt.  Cover and chill.

Per serving: 230 cal, 21 g pro, 10 g fat, 15 g car, 182 mg sod.

Melt oleo and peanut butter together add sugar - when stiff roll into
balls the size of a walnut.  Place on waxpaper and trays, put in
freezer until chocolate and parafin is melted.  Melt chocolate and
parafin in double boiler a little at a time.  Dip balls with
toothpick into chocolate.  Set on wax paper to cool.  This makes 10
dozen or more.

Thaw spinach and squeeze until dry.  In medium bowl stir together
spinach sour cream, mayonnaise, soup mix, finely chopped water
chestnuts and finely chopped green onions.  Cover, refrigerate 2
hours.  If desired, serve with pumpernickel bread or crackers.  Makes
3 cups.

Start heating oven to 350.  Grease 13X9 pan, then line with waxed
paper. Sift dry ingrediants into large mixing bowl.  Drop in
shortening.  Pour in 3/4 cup milk and vanilla with mixer at low
speed, beat 2 1/2 minutes scraping bowl as necessary.  Add 1/2 cup
milk and eggs.  Beat 2 1/2 minutes longer.  Pour into pan and bake 35
minutes.  Cool on wire rack 10 minutes. Remove from pan and peel off
paper.  Cool on rack and use icing of your choice, or fudge icing.

Soak the beans overnight in ample water.  The next day drain the
water from the beans, and place in a heavy kettle.  Add the ham,
onion, celery, parsley, bay leaves, and garlic, and add water to the
pot barely to cover the contents.  Bring to a boil, and then turn to
a simmer.  Simmer, uncovered, for 2 hours, being careful that the
beans do not stick or become too dry.  You may have to add a little
water.  After the intial two hours of cooking, add the margarine,
pepper, Worcestershire, and Tabasco to the pot.  Continue cooking for
1 more hour, this time with a lid on the pot and the heat quite low.
Correct the seasonings.  You may wish to add a bit of salt, but do
not add salt until this point because salt cooks out of the ham hocks
or ham and seasons the dish well.  Serve over white rice with a nice
green salad and a good white wine or beer.

Combine drained beans, milk, soup, pepper and half of the french fried
onions (3/4 cup french fried onions for regular six serving);pour
