Spread in crust and refrigerate 3 to 4 hours.  Drizzle with chocolate
syrup to serve.

Mix all ingredients and pour into a greased & floured bundt cake pan.
Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.

Butter 9 X 13 pan. Cover bottom of pan with chilies.  In bowl, beat
eggs and add milk.  Add cheese and mix.  Pour mix over chilies in
pan.  Bake at 350 for 40 minutes.

Mix sugar, peanuts, salt and Karo syrup together and microwave on high
four minutes.  Stir using a wooden spoon and microwave an additional
four minutes.  Add butter and vanilla and stir till butter is melted.
Microwave an additional two minutes.  Sprinkle baking soda over mix
and stir. Quickly pour into 3 greased pie pans while mix is foaming.
Beware of "Spoon in the Stone"!  Cool and Enjoy!

Trim fat off pork roast.  Salt, pepper, red pepper, and garlic powder
the roast on all sides.  Brown roast on all sides in a pot.  Add 1
jar of saurkraut and 1/2 to 1 saurkraut jar of water.  Cook with lid
on on low for 4 1/2 to 5 hours.  Goes well with Grandma Gunsallus'
Dumplings.
Place ham in stock pot and boil for 4 hours.

Cook pasta:
1. Heat 5 quarts of water & 1 tablespoon of salt to a rolling boil.
2. Stir in pasta and return to boiling.
3. Boil uncovered 6 minutes stirring occasionally.
4. Drain well and cool in single layer on wax paper.
Manicotti with cheese:
Heat oven to 350F. In large bowl, stir together cheeses, parsley,
salt and pepper; spoon into cooled pasta tubes.  Spread thin layer of
sauce on bottom of 13X9X2 inch baking dish; arrange filled pasta in
single layer over sauce.  Pour remaining sauce over pasta; cover with
foil.  Bake 40 minutes.  Remove foil; bake 15 minutes longer or until
hot and bubbly.

Melt butter in 9 X 13 pan.  Make a batter with the flour, 1 cup of
sugar, baking powder and milk.  Pour over butter.  Mix and spoon over
batter the fruit, 1 cup of sugar, and lemon juice.  Bake 45 minutes
at 350 until brown on top.
Blend all ingredients and serve with tortilla chips.

Mix together and form into balls.  It should make about 20-22
depending on size.  Place in a single layer in 9 X 12 dish.  Pour
sauce over and bake 45 to 60 minutes depending on size.

Sauce: Bring to a boil making sure cranberry sauce is dissolved. Pour
over meat balls.

The meat balls freeze well.  I usually make the sauce and pour over
them just before putting them in the oven.  This is a generous amount
of sauce. I made 1 recipe of sauce for 2 recipes of meatballs
depending on how well you like to have them covered.

Peel and quarter the apples and wrap each quarter in a crescent roll.
Place in an 8X8 greased pan.  Bring to a boil margarine, vanilla,
sugar, and orange juice.  Pour over dumplings and bake at 350 until
brown about 15 to 20 minutes.

Save 1 cup of cheese to sprinkle on top for the the last 20 minutes.
Diced mushrooms, green or red pepper or other veggies can be added
also.

Mix all together and bake at 350 for 1 hour.

If you are cooking the night before, wait and put the cheese on top
when you are ready to heat it.  Heat at 250 for about 20-30 minutes.

Mix sugar and Karo.  Bring to a complete boil (you will need to stir).
Remove from heat.  Add peanut butter and stir until mixed well.  Pour
mix over Coco Puffs in a large bowl and stir well.  Spoon onto wax
paper. Chill in ice box for 20-30 minutes.

Saute chopped onion in olive oil then add cut okra and saute.  Add
diced tomatoes and a little water to the onion and okra.  Squeeze on
lemon juice.  Salt & pepper to taste.  Cook covered on low for about
15 minutes or until tender.  Serve over rice.

Slice & dice all the tomatoes, onions, and jalapenos into small 1/4"
pieces and place into large bowl.  Add all 3 salts and mix with a
large spoon for a about one minute.  Take one cup at a time and place
into a blender and press the pulse button for approximately one
second.  Do this step 4 or 5 times for each cup.  Blend chunkiness to
your particular preference, then place in large bowl and mix with
large spoon.  For a great taste use Tostitos 100% white corn crispy
round chips.

Preheat oven to 400F.  Place skinless boneless chicken breasts in 9X13
inch baking dish.  Slather mustard evenly over chicken, then pour
teriyaki sauce evenly over all, then cover with cheese.  Bake at 400F
for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Drain the spinach, squeeze dry and set
aside.  Combine the cream cheese and soup in a saucepan over low and
cook until blended, stirring constantly.  Combine the soup mixure,
spinach, water chestnuts and 2/3 of the French-fried onions in a bowl
and mix well.
Pour into a greased 1-quart casserole and sprinkle with the remaining
onions.  Bake for 20 minutes.

Brown ground meat and onion and drain.  Combine all ingredients in
casserole and top with tator tots.  Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

Add water to chicken broth to make 4 quarts.  Add soup.  Bring to a
boil and drop Mary B's dumplings that have been cut into 8 pieces.
Reduce heat and cook coverd for 40 minutes or until dumplings are
done.  Add deboned chicken to dumplings and let stand 10 minutes.

1. Preheat broiler.  In large bowl with fork, mix squeezed dried
spinach, eggs, egg whites, green onions, feta, 1/2 cup mozzarella,
and 1/4 teaspoon salt until well blended.
2. In broiler-safe nonstick 10-inch skillet, heat oil over medium
heat. Pour egg mixture into skillet; arrange tomatoes on top, pushing
softly down.  Cover skillet and cook frittata 5 to 6 minutes or until
egg mixture is just set around edge.
3. Place skillet in broiler 5 to 6 inches from source of heat and
broil frittata 4 to 5 minutes or until just firm in center.  Sprinkle
with remaining 1/4 cup mozzarella; broil about a minute longer or
until cheese melts.
4. To serve, loosen frittata from skillet.  Leave frittata in skillet
or slide onto warm platter; cut into wedges.

Each serving: About 230 calories, 19g protein, 6g carbohydrate, 14g
total fat (6g saturated), 2g fiber, 233 mg cholesteral, 570 mg sodium.

Brown ground meat with onion & garlic and then drain.  Add remaining
ingredients and heat. Vary beef broth for desired consistency and
Rotel for desired spice.

In a frying pan brown (sear) roast on all sides with 1 tablespoon
of oil. Season roast with spices and place in oven bag with 1 cup of
water. Bake at 350 30 minutes per pound.  1 hour before done add
vegetables (baby carrots, chunk size potatoes, onion) and continue
baking remainder of time or until vegetables are tender.

Brown sausage & drain.  Melt Velveeta cheese and combine with sausage
and rotel in a crock pot.

Combine all ingredients except butter and rolls.  Place mixture on
crescent rolls and roll up.  (They'll be pudgy.)  Brush tops with
butter and bake as instructed on roll package until golden brown.

Brown ground meat and onion with salt, pepper, and garlic powder to
taste and drain grease.  Brown sausage and drain grease.  Fry, drain,
and crumble bacon. Peel and chop fine the apple. Mix all ingredients
together. Smoke at 250 to 300 degrees for about 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
Can baked in the oven at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Can put in the crock
pot on high till heated through then on low about 3 or 4 hours.

Heat pumpin and milk but not to boiling.  Beat eggs slightly and add
heated pumpkin and milk mixture.

Mix together the sugar and spices and add to the pumpkin mixture.
Beat thorougly.  Pour into unbaked pie shell.  Bake at 400 for 10
minutes then reduce heat to 350 and bake 40 more minutes.

Brown ground beef with diced onion and bell pepper, drain and set
aside. Mix yellow cornmeal, flour, salt, and baking soda.  To the
cornmeal mixture add cream style corn, milk, egg, oil, and diced
jalapenos.  Add meat mixture and grated velveeta.  Stir and pour into
greased casserole dish.  Bake at 350 for 1 hour.

Cook beef and drain grease.  Mix taco sauce and refried beans
together. Layer beef, beans and cheese in casserole dish.  Crumple
chips on top and bake at 350 for about 30 minutes.  Can be served
alone or used as a dip.

Serving Size 177.2g
Amount per serving      % Daily Value*
319 calories
Calories from Fat 126
Total Fat 14.0g         22%
Saturated Fat 7.6g      38%
Cholesterol 84mg        28%
Sodium 560mg            23%
Total Carbs 19.2g       6%
Dietary Fiber 3.5g      14%
Sugars 2.0g
Protein 28.2g
Vitamin A               15%
Calcium                 27%
Vitamin C               13%
Iron                    17%
* Based ona 2000 calorie diet

name: Chocolate Frosty Home Made Ice Cream
author: Jason Milam

instructions.content:
Beat eggs until foamy.  Stir in Eagle Brand and Cool Whip.  Pour into
can. Add chocolate milk to fill line.

1. Unroll 1 pkg of crescent rolls in the bottom of a greased 13X9 pan.
2. Whip cream cheese, sugar and vanilla and spread over crescent
rolls. 3. Top with second pkg of crescent rolls.
4. Pour melted butter over crescent rolls and top with sugar and
cinnamon mixture.
5. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

40 minutes, 10 minutes prep
1 serving (110g)
410 calories, Calories from Fat 215 (52%)
Total Fat 23.9g
Saturated Fat 14.3g
Polyunsat. Fat 1.1g
Monounsat Fat 6.9g
Trans Fat 0.0g
Cholesterol 81 mg
Sodium 342 mg
Potassium 89 mg
Total Carbohydrate 43.9g
Dietary Fiber 1.3g
Sugars 28.1g
Protein 6.4g

Combine all ingredients above except avocado and lime juice. Chop
avocado and soak in lime juice.  Add to salsa prior to serving.  Good
to prepare the night before to let flavors mingle.

Can use a can of diced tomatoes drained instead of 2 tomatoes chopped.
Chopped black olives are optional.

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.

2. Cube and season boneless skinless chicken breasts with salt &
pepper, place in microwave safe dish, cover and cook in microwave for
five to six minutes.  Turn and cook another two to three minutes or
until cooked through and no longer pink inside.  Let cool.

3. In 9X13 inch baking dish, combine chicken, rice and soup and mix
well. Top with cheese, then with bread cubes.

4. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly
and bread is crunchy.

465 calories per serving.

Shuck & clean fresh ears of corn. Place all in pot of water and bring
to a boil for at least 5 minutes.  Continue to cook at simmer until
ready to eat.

Soften butter and mix with brown sugar.  Stir in eggs.  Stir in baking
soda, baking powder, salt and vanilla.  Stir in flour and then whole
pecans.  Bake large size cookies at 350 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes.

Brown sausage and drain.  Add cream cheese to sausage, stir until
melted. Add minced onion.  Spread 1 can crescent rolls on cookie
sheet. Top with sausage mixture.  Top with second can of crescent
rolls and pinch sides to hold in filling.  Bake at 375 for 11
minutes.  Cut into squares.

Do not use any type of metal spoon or bowl for mixing.  Do not
refrigerate.  If air gets in the bag let it out.  It is normal for the
batter to rise and ferment.

Day 1: Do nothing.  This is the day you receive the batter.  Make
sure the bag is dated.
Day 2: Mush the bag.
Day 3: Mush the bag.
Day 4: Mush the bag.
Day 5: Mush the bag.
Day 6: Add to the bag 1 C flour, 1 C sugar, and 1 C milk, mush the
bag. Day 7: Mush the bag.
Day 8: Mush the bag.
Day 9: Mush the bag.
Day 10: Mix and divide the starter as follows; Pour the entire
contents into a nonmetal bowl along with 1 1/2 C flour, 1 1/2 C
sugar, and 1 1/2 C milk.  Measure 1 C of batter into four 1 gallon
Ziploc bags.  Keep one for yourself and give the other three to
friends along with a copy of this recipe.  Make sure the bags are
dated.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Add to the remaining batter (~ 1 1/2c):
3 eggs
1 C oil (or 1/2 C oil and 1/2 C applesauce)
1 C sugar
2 tsp cinnamon
1/2 tsp vanilla
1 1/2 tsp baking powder
1/2 tsp baking soda
1/2 tsp salt
2 C flour
1 large box instant vanilla pudding

Grease two large loaf pans and mix an additional 1/2 C sugar and 1/2
tsp cinnamon.  Dust the greased pans with half of the mixture.  Pour
batter evenly into the pans and sprinkle with remaining sugar.  Bake
1 hour.  Cool until bread loosens from pan evenly (about 10 minutes).
Turn over onto serving dish.  Serve warm or cold.

Options: Add 1 C chopped nuts or raisins.  You can exchange chocolate
pudding for vanilla.

Be sure to tell the recipient which day the bag is at when presented
to them.

Note: If you keep a starter for yourself you will be baking every 10
days. Only the Amish know how to create a starter so if you give them
all away, you will have to wait until someone gives you back a
starter.

Dice into small chunks.  Wash cilantro very well.  Remove jalopena
seeds. Mix well and refridgerate over night.  Toss well before
serving.

Tomatoes should be seeded and chopped (about 3 cups total).  Mix all
ingredients. I used a food processor. Makes about 3 1/2 cups Salsa.

Preheat oven to 425.  Mix all ingredients in 3 quart casserole dish.
Cover and bake for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Remove cover &
bake an additional 15 minutes.

Heat soup & butter till butter is melted. Pour half of soup in
greased 9 X 11 dish.  Spread rice, place chicken pieces, and cover
with rest of soup. Cover with foil and cook for 2 1/2 hours at 350.

Cook noodles according to package directions; drain and set aside.
Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat; stir in flour and
salt, pepper, and dried basil.  Add broth, stirring until smoooth;
bring to a boil.  Reduce heat and simmer 5-8 minutes or until
thickened and bubbly. Stir in chicken and remove from heat.  Combine
cottage cheese and egg, stirring well.  Spoon one-third of chicken
mixture in bottom of lightly greased 13X9X2 inch baking dish.  Top
with half of noodles, half of cottage cheese mixture and 1 cup
mozzarella cheese.  Repeat layers, ending with chicken mixture.
Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.  Bake at 350 for 1 hour.

Drain liquid off beans. Divide into individual serving bundles,
approximately 10 green beans, wrapping with 1/2 slice of bacon.
Secure with toothpicks.  Place in 9X13 inch baking dish.  Mix butter,
brown sugar and garlic salt.  Pour over green bean bundles.  Bake at
350 for 30 minutes.  Broil for 1-3 minutes to crisp bacon.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees.  Steam carrots and broccoli in a covered
pot for 3 minutes, until slightly tender but still firm. In a large
bowl, mix together carrots, broccoli, cooked and chopped chicken,
soup, milk, and cheese. Spread one pie crust in dish and slightly
brown in oven then spoon in mixture and cover top with the other pie
crust.  Seal edges and cut steam vents in top. Bake in preheated oven
for 30 minutes, until golden brown.

Heat some oil in a saute pan over medium-high heat.  Place the frozen
chicken tenders in the pan, and season with salt, pepper, and Greek
seasoning.  Cook until the chicken is lightly browned and has fully
cooked.  Add the green beans, olives, tomatoes, and sour cream with
italian seasoning.  Cover and simmer for 10 minutes to heat the
vegetables. Serve over angel hair pasta cooked according to package
directions. Prep time 10 minutes. Cook time 20 minutes. From all
recipes.com

Preheat oven to 350.  Melt 1 stick butter, combine with soup,
sourcream, cut up cheese slices, onion, salt, and pepper.  Add thawed
potatoes. Spread into greased 9X13 dish.  Top with crushed cornflakes
and pour 1/2 stick melted butter on top. Bake for 1 hour.

Toast the almonds: 15 minutes on an ungreased baking pan in the oven
at 350 degrees F stirring occassionally until golden brown.

Scatter half of the toasted almonds over 2 baking sheets (one large
baking sheet and one small to medium baking sheet).  Reserve
remaining almonds for the topping.

Break the chocolate bars into pieces and set aside.

In a heavy 3-quart saucepan over medium heat, bring the butter,
sugar, and water to a boil, stirring until the sugar dissolves and
the mixture begins to boil. Cook, stirring constantly, to the hard
crack stage (300F).  Keep stirring to 300F even though the mixture
will be smoking.

Remove from the heat.  Quickly stir in the vanilla.

Immediately pour a thin layer of hot toffee over the almonds on the
baking sheets.  (The toffee will not completely cover the baking
sheets).

Immediately place the chocolate pieces on top of the hot toffee, the
chocolate will melt within a few minutes.  Using a flat metal spatula
or a knife, spread the melted chocolate in an even layer over the
toffee.

Sprinkle with the reserved almonds, lightly pressing the almonds into
the chocolate with the palms of your hands.

Let stand until the chocolate is firm.  The toffee may be cooled in
the refrigerator or freezer if preferred.  Break into pieces. Store
in an airtight container at room temperature, in the refrigerator, or
in the freezer as desired.  Do not store in a container with other
candies.

Cook's Notes: This candy is extradelicious when made with toasted
almond topping sold in ice cream speciality stores such as Braum's,
Haagen-Dazs, or Ben & Jerry's. Remember to use high-quality
ingredients, because the better the butter, the better the toffee.
It takes about 45 minutes to make this candy.  The recipe may be
doubled and cooked in a heavy 5-quart kettle.

Mix all ingredients, spray 2 quart dish with Pam, bake at 375 for 45
minutes.

Saute onion and garlic with vegetable oil in large soup pot.  Add
remaining ingredients and bring to a boil.  Reduce heat and simmer
for 1 hour.  To serve, place chips, cheese and avocados in bowl and
pour soup over.  Top with sour cream.

Pour undrained pineapple in bottom of 9X13 dish.  Cover with
blueberries. Pour 3/4 c sugar over berries.  Sprinkle dry cake mix
over the top of the sugar.  Melt Margarine and drizzle over cake mix.
Sprinkle chopped pecans next.  Finally 1/4 c sugar on top. Bake at
350 for 25 minutes.  Then take a long fork and poke top of cake 20
times.  Cook for 15 minutes longer.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.  Butter a 1 quart baking dish and
place in a roasting pan which has enough hot water to come halfway up
the side of the baking dish.  Place in the oven to heat.  Combine the
eggs, egg yolks and sugar, and whisk until thick and pale.  Heat the
milk to boiling point and slowly add to the egg mixture, stirring
constantly.  Stir in the vanilla.  Strain through a sieve into the
baking dish and sprinkle with nutmeg.  Place in the roasting pan and
bake for 45 minutes, until set. The custard is set when a knife
inserted in the center comes out clean.

Calories: 138
Fat: 5g
Cholesterol: 140mg
Carbohydrates: 17g
Protein: 6g
Sodium: 71mg

Rinse & dry lettuce (Green leaf & Romaine - not iceberg) and tear into
bite size pieces.  Combine cubed swiss cheese, crumbled feta cheese,
and shredded Parmesan cheese with the lettuce in a large bowl. In a
small bowl, whisk together oil, vinegar, Italian seasoning, and
pepper.  Add dressing to salad and toss well. Toast pecans pieces
with a little butter and sprinkle on top.

If using roll out pie crust place in deep pie pan.  Spinkle basil or
oregano over thawed pie crust.  Mix eggs, milk, pepper, & salt and
pour into crust.  Mix cheese & flour and sprinkle over egg mixture in
pan. Sprinkle meat and/or vegetables over pan.  Bake at 350 for 40-45
minutes.

Can use cooked chopped ham or turkey instead of rotisserie chicken.
Can use Shredded Swiss or Mozzarella cheese instead of Parmesan.

Mix together and cook over low heat until smooth.  Good to pour over
broccoli, cauliflower, brussel sprouts etc.  (From Cooks.com)

Allow butter to soften at room temperature.  Mix sugar and flour.
Cream butter with sugar and flour mixture.  Add corn syrup and beaten
eggs. Beat with mixer until frothy.  Add 1/3 cup of melted chocolate
chips and beat with mixer some more.  Add salt, vanilla, 1/4 cup of
chocolate chips and pecans.  Stir by hand.  Pour into unbaked pie
shell.  Bake at 325F for 45 minutes.  Garnish top with a few more
chocolate chips.

Crumble sausage into a medium skillet.  Cook over medium heat until
evenly brown; drain.  In a medium bowl, mix together mustard powder,
salt, eggs, and milk.  Add the sausage, cheese.  Cube the toasted
bread and add.  Stir to coat eavenly.  Pour into a greased 9 X 13
inch baking dish.  Cover, and chill in the refrigerator for 8 hours,
or overnight.  Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.  Cover, and bake 45 to
60 minutes.  Uncover, and reduce temperature to 325 degrees F.  Bake
for an additional 30 minutes, or until set.

Prep time: 20 minutes  Cook Time: 1 Hour 30 Minutes  Ready in: 9
Hours 50 Minutes

Stir fry onion, celery, chicken and bell peppers with Tony Zachery's
and Tamerine Sours in olive oil until onions are clear.  In a large
pot add the stir fry, chicken broth, chinese cabbage and squash.
Bring to a boil and then add mushrooms, shrimp, ciantro, and
pineapple.  Add Kikoman soy sauce to water and then add to the pot.
Bring pot back to a boil.  Serve in a soup bowl over steamed rice.

Mix the corn, sour cream, cream cheese, and chilies in a bowl.  You
may have to let the cream cheese soften a little first.  Spread out
mixture in a casserole dish.  Top with cheddar cheese, and bake at
350 degrees until melted (about 20 minutes).

Mix veg-all, cheese, and mayo.  Place in baking dish.  Bake for 20 to
30 minutes.  Flatten top of casserole (it should bubble at edge).
Remove from oven.  Top with Ritz cracker & margarine mix.  Smooth it
flat to casserole.  Bake about 10 more minutes.  This can also be put
together with topping and baked all at once.

Spread 1 can of crescent rolls in a 9X13 dish.  Mix cream cheese and
sugar and spread over crescent rolls.  Top with 2nd can of crescent
rolls.  Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until brown.

Cook all except corn, green beans, peas, and diced tomatoes until
done (~ 2hours).  Add corn, green beans, peas, and diced tomatoes and
simmer about an hour.

Soften one stick of butter in microwave then add cake mix and two
eggs. Put in 9X11 cake pan.  Sprinkle with cinnamon.  Soften another
stick of butter and cream cheese.  Mix in a box of powdered sugar and
two eggs. Pour over top of cake mixture in pan.  Sprinkle with
cinnamon and top with broken pecans.  Bake at 300 on top rack for 1
hour to 1 hour and 15 minutes until top is toasted brown.

Cook beef in 10" skillet until well browned, stirring to break up
meat. Pour off fat.  Stir in soup, salsa, water and the tortillas cut
into 1" pieces.  Heat to a boil.  Reduce heat to low and cook for 5
minutes. Stir.  Top with cheese.

Creamy Mexican Fiesta: Stir in 1/2 cup sour cream with soup.
Ranchero Style: Use corn tortillas instead of flour tortillas and
shredded Mexican cheese blend instead of Cheddar.

Prep: 5 min.  Cook: 20 min.

Melt butter; remove from heat. Stir in flour and seasonings.
Gradually add milk, stirring until well mixed. Cook over low heat,
stirring constantly, until thickened and smooth.  Cook for 5 minutes
longer; add cheese.  Stir until smooth and well blended.  Serve with
pasta or vegetables. Makes 2 cups.

1. Mix cinnamon and sugar.
2. Cut biscuits in fourths and roll 1/2 of the biscuits in sugar
mixture. 3. Place those biscuits in a well-greased angel food or
Bundt cake pan. 4. In saucepan, heat butter, brown sugar, and nuts
until butter is melted. 5. Pour 1/2 of this mixture over biscuits.
6. Roll the remaining biscuits in sugar mixture and place in baking
pan. 7. Pour rest of liquid mixture over the biscuits.
8. Bake at 350 for 35-40 min.
9. Let stand for 10 min. before removing from pan.

Heat oven to 350 degrees.  Cook pasta according to package directions,
drain and place in large bowl.  In a pan, saute mushrooms, celery, and
onion in margarine and set aside.  Stir soups and milk together and
add to pasta.  Add Turkey, mushrooms, onions, celery and 1/2 cup
cheese mixing together lightly.  Transfer mixture to 8 X 13 baking
dish, cover and cook for 30 minutes.  Sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup
cheese over the dish and return to oven to cook another 10 minutes,
or until the top is golden brown.

1. Heat broth, black pepper, carrot and celery in 2 qt saucepan over
medium-high heat to a boil.
2. Stir noodles and chicken in saucepan. Reduce heat to medium.  Cook
10 minutes or until noodles are tender, stirring often.

Bake Jiffy cornmuffin mix.  Run 3 c of croutons through the food
processor.  Mix all ingredients together and cook in crockpot on high
for 2 hours and low for 1 additional hour. (I stir regulary to avoid
stickin on the edges).

Preheat oven to 400 degrees.  Prepare stuffing mix as directed on
package; set aside.  Cut chicken breasts into 1 inch pieces.  Thaw and
drain frozen broccoli florets.  Mix chicken and broccoli in 13X9 inch
baking dish.  Stir in soup, milk, and cheese; top with the prepared
stuffing.  Bake 30 minutes or until heated through.

Place meat in slow cooker.  In a bowl mix together the flour, salt,
and pepper; pour oer meat, and stir to coat meat with the flour
mixture.  Stir in the garlic, bay leaf, paprika, Worcestershire
sauce, onion, beef broth, potatoes, carrots, and celery.  Cover, and
cook on low setting for 12 hours, or on high setting for 6 hours.

In a large saucepan, combine the peeled and cubed potatoes, onion,
carrot, celery and broth.  Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and
simmer for 12-15 minutes or until vegetables are tender; lightly mash.

Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, melt butter; stir in flour until
smooth. Gradually stir in milk.  Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2
minutes or until thickened.  Stir into potato mixture.  Cook and stir
until thickened and bubbly.  Add parsley, salt and pepper.  Remove
from the heat; stir in cheese until melted.

Prep Time: 5 Minutes
Cook Time: 25 Minutes
Ready in: 30 Minutes
Found in Allrecipes.com

Mix cookie ingredients, roll out, and cut out cookies.  Bake at 350
for a short time - but not until brown.  Ice while still warm.

Mix butter, sugar, brown sugar, eggs, and vanilla.  Ground oatmeal in
blender and add along with remaining ingredients.  Bake at 350 a short
while but not until brown.

Mix sugar and oil and stir in eggs and vanilla.  Add flour, soda, and
salt to sugar mixture, sprinkle cinnamon in melted butter, then add
rest of ingredients.  Bake at 350 10-12 minutes.

Mix all together & simmer for one hour stirring occasionaly.  Freezes
well.
For spicier chili use cajun tomatoes instead of Mexican tomatoes and
use hot McCormick chili mix instead of mild McCormick chili mix.

Mix margarine, sugar, peanut butter, and vanilla well.  Roll into
balls. Melt chocolate chips over double boiler.  Coat balls in
chocolate.

name: Mike's Creamy Chicken & Wild Rice Soup
author: Mike Furstenau

instructions.content:
In a large pot over medium heat, combine broth, water, chicken and
vegetables.  Bring just to boiling, then add rice (reserve seasoning
packet), cover and remove from heat.

In a small bowl, combine flour, salt and pepper.

In a medium sauce pan over medium heat, melt butter.  Add reserved
seasoning packet and continue to heat until mixture is bubbly. Reduce
heat to low and stir in flour mixture slowly by individual spoonfuls
until all is incorporated.

Whisk in cream a little at a time until the mixture is smooth.
continue to cook until thickened, about 5 minutes.

Put the large pot with the broth back on medium heat and stir in the
roux (butter/cream mixture). Simmer over medium heat, stirring
occasionally, about 10 to 15 minutes.

Place rice in a greased 12 X 8 X 2 in. baking dish.  Cover the rice
with the combined vegetables and seasonings.   Combine soup and mayo,
mix well.
Gradually add water to soup mixture.  Top with cheese slices.  Bake
at 350 for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until chicken is tender and rice
is cooked.  Sprinkle with paprika.

Cook in a pan for 1 to 2 minutes until thick and translucent the
sugar, cornstarch, salt and cold water.   Pour hot mixture into
slightly beaten egg yolks. (Save the egg whites for the meringue).
Pour slowly so you don't make scrambled eggs.  Pour all back into the
pan and add lemon rinds.  Stir until boiling.  Add butter then add
lemon juice.  Mix and pour into pie shells.

Pie Crust: Sift with 2 forks the pie crust ingredients.  Don't over
sift. Make two balls and then roll out onto wax paper with flour.
Lift into pie dish and poke with holes.  Bake at 350 until golden
brown.

Fold together instant vanilla pudding, Eagle Brand and water.  Set in
ice box.  Mix and whip for 2 minutes the whipping cream, sugar, and
vanilla. Folder together the pudding mixture with the whipping cream
mixture. Layer dish with vanilla waffers and then sliced bananas.
Layer with mixture. Layer again with vanilla waffers slice bananas
and mixture. Refrigerate.

Boil the chicken and cut up in small pieces, set aside.  Mix together
sour cream, soup, and chicken.  Melt the butter, add the poppy seeds
to the butter and stir.  Crush the Ritz Crackers into pieces.  Add
the crackers to the butter & poppy seed mixture.  Take 1/2 of the
mixture and spread on the botom of a 13 X 9 pan, sprayed with Pam.
Pour the chicken mixture over the crackers.  Spread evenly.  Use the
rest of your cracker mixture to cover the top of the casserole.  Bake
at 350 for 30 minutes.

Beat together all ingredients except tomato sauce.  Place in 9 X 13
casserole dish.  Pour tomato sauce over top.  Bake 1 hour at 350.

Bake the German chocolate cake mix.  Prepare large and small instant
chocolate pudding with milk.  Crush the Heath bars.  In a punch bowl
layer ingredients: pieces of cake, pudding, cool whip, Heath bar, and
carmel. Repeat 3 times.  If you like you can put a few holes in the
cake with a toothpick and put a little Kuhlua in it.
Mix all together in a blender.

Brown the beef with salt and onions then drain and add cheese and
olives. Stir sauce indgredients together and warm over low heat.
Spoon meat mixture into tortillas dipped in sauce, roll and place in
dish.  Cover with remaining sauce and bake at 350 until heated thru
then sprinkle cheese on top and heat until melted.

Mix together salt, pepper and paprika and rub all over the meat.
Brown the meat in a covered dutch oven with oil.  Reduce heat and add
tomato juice and 1 cup water, bay leaves, and cinnamon stick.  Add
peeled, cut vegetables.  Cover and cook ~ 3 hours on low.

Combine soups & chicken in slow cooker; cook on low all day.  Shred
chicken breast & add back to slow cooker.  Cut velveeta into small
cubes & add, let cheese melt and serve over your favorite pasta.

Cream salad oil and sugar.  Beat in eggs.  Stir in pumpkin, add and
mix in dry ingredients.  Pour into ungreased tube cake pan or bunt
pan. (Line bottom of pan with wax paper).  Bake at 350 deg oven for 1
hour & 15 minutes, check.  When bread is cool remove from pan.  Bread
may be toasted for breakfast or topped with whipped cream or cream
cheese for a dessert.

** Note: Check with a toothpick after 1 hour & 15 minutes and add
additional time as needed.

Cook pasta according to package directions.  In a large bowl combine
chicken, pineapple, celery, onions, grapes, and cranberries.  Drain
pasta & rinse in cold water, stir into chicken mixture.  In a small
bowl whisk the ranch dressing and mayonnaise, pour over salad and
toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour just before serving
stir in nuts.

Preheat ovent to 350 degrees.  In a large bowl, stir together the
soups and rotel.  Stir in the chicken.  In a greased 13 X 9 inch pan,
layer the tortillas and the chicken mixture beginning and ending with
tortillas. Sprinkle the cheese over the casserole and bake for 30
minutes.

Prep time: 10 minutes
Cook time: 30 minutes
From Paula's Home Cooking/Lady and Sons Too! Cookbook

Put all ingredients in a crock pot and cook on high for 4 hours.
Chicken can be frozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Bring a large pot of salted water to a
boil.  Add potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 15
minutes.  Drain and mash.  Prepare stuffing as directed.  Place the
stuffing in a 2 quart baking dish.  Layer with turkey and cover with
1 cup gravy. Top with mashed potatoes and remaining gravy. Bake
covered in the preheated oven 45 minutes or until bubbly and lightly
browned.

Good use of Thanksgiving leftovers in a single dish.

Place chicken in cold skillet, cover and turn to 275, when valve
clicks, turn chicken.  Slice potatoes on #4 cone and onion on #2 cone
and place on top of chicken.  Add broccoli, soup and cover.  When
valve clicks, reduce to 200 and cook 25 minutes. Serve over cooked
rice or noodles.

Can use frozen mixed veggies instead of broccoli.
Can use cream of mushroom soup instead of cream of chicken soup.

In large bowl mix pumpkin, cake mix and eggs.  Spray large skillet
with a baking spray.  Pour mixture in pan and spread out evenly.
Cover and set temperature on medium-low.  Allow to cook for 15
minutes before checking your cake.  If center is firm its done.  If
still wet in the center of cake cover again and check on it in 5-10
minutes.  Let cake cool and sprinkle with powder sugar.  Enjoy

Throw your cooked chicken in a pan over med-high heat.  Let it get
just a little heat on it then sprinkle it with the taco seasoning.
Use what you have, this would be great with chicken or beef taco
seasoning.  Don't add any water!!  Just leave it in there dry.  Give
it a stir to get everything all coated in the spices.  Let that go
for maybe 5-7 minutes, get it all heated through, Then add the Ranch
dressing.  Stir it around & warm it through again 2-3 minutes.  Put
extra squirt of Ranch dressing on the taco.

Spray crock pot with non-stick spray.  Layer the potatoes, bacon,
cheese, and onion in two layers of each.  In a bowl beat eggs, milk,
and seasoning.  Pour over ingredients in crock pot.  Cook 8 hours on
low (make sure eggs are set/thoroughly cooked).

Layer in 9 X 13 pan, 1 loaf of bread with the crust removed with cream
cheese cubed and placed on the slices of bread. Mix eggs, syrup, and
milk and pour over bread and cheese. Refrigerate over night.  Bake at
375 for 45 minutes.  Sprinkle with powdered sugar or maple syrup.

Wash and dry grapes.  Cream together cream cheese, sour cream, sugar
and vanilla until smooth.  Fold grapes into this mixture.  Spread
grape mixture into a dish (2-quart oblong or whatever you prefer).
Sprinkle top with crushed butterfingers then top off with crushed
pecans.  Press and chill for at least two hours.  (I put it in the
refrigerator overnight). (You can also cut the grapes in half before
mixing.)

Toss chicken, salad dressing, and bar-b-que sauce into a zip lock
freezer bag and refrigerate overnight.  Toss into crockpot and cook
approximately 4 hours.  Remove chicken when done and shred.  Drain
liquid and set aside.
Return chicken to crock pot to keep warm.  Add liquid as needed to
keep moist.

Cook bacon till crisp; drain and crumble, reserving drippings.  Add
onion to drippings; cook till tender.  Add vinegar, 1/4 cup water,
sugar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and bacon; cook and stir till boiling.
Place lettuce in bowl; pour hot dressing over; toss to coat.  Garnish
with radishes and egg.  Serveral generous twists of a pepper mill
along with Parmesan cheese and crisp Caesar Croutons, add gest.

Stir barbque sauce, onion, ketchup, brown sugar, salt, pepper and
chili power in slow cooker.  Add pork loin and coat with sauce.
Cover and cook on high until pork is very tender, about 4 1/2 hours.
Shred pork with 2 forks.  Keep warm on low until ready to serve.

1. Combine all ingredients EXCEPT chips in a bowl; mix well
2. Crush chips in bag to small pieces
3. Alternate layers of chicken mixture and chips in a large casserole
dish.
4. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until heated through center.

Note: From Natural Gas Newsletter - I used rotisserie chicken from
Walmart. Thought a little too spicy with Regular Rotel.

Prep Time: 15-20 minutes
Cook Time: 30-45 minutes
Level: Very Easy

Nutrition Facts Per Serving:
Calories 386; Calories from Fat 163; Total Fat 18.1g; Saturated Fat
3.2g Cholesterol 57mg; Sodium 920mg; Total Carbohydrate 30.3g;
Dietary Fiber 1.8g; Sugars 1.9g; Protein 25.6g

1. Combine beans, onion, rotel, tomato sauce, and taco seasoning.
2. Place chicken on top & cover with a thin layer of the sauce &
beans. 3. Cook on high for 6 hours.
4. About a half hour before serving, remove chicken and shred in a
separate bowl.
5. Place shredded chicken into the slow cooker and stir in to combine
with beans, etc.
6. Cover and place slow cooker on "warm" setting for 30 minutes to
allow chicken to soak in the chili flavor.
